text: Their service was the best. I was run off the road a few hours earlier in the day by a wreckless driver and damaged my tire. I was looking to get it fixed and was pressed against closing time. I arrived and the manager and workers assisted me by repairing my tire. It brought tears to my eyes upon leaving because you rarely find nice people anymore. I greatly appreciated their generous service.

resp.text:
T Walker,

Thank you very much for your generous review and for sharing this experience! It is moments like these that remind us why we are in the auto repair business! We greatly appreciate you for stopping in and look forward to giving you another five-star experience on your next visit! Thanks! - TW

name: Lan Lupe Lòpez
text: Idler arm destroyed because they did not take time to make sure vehicle is safe it is a 4x4 that has a tow package and carries a family very unprofessional.Lugs not tightened correctly cost me a ton of cash just now. They also take down reviews can’t find my other one.

resp.text:
Lan Lupe Lopez,

I am sorry that you had an unsatisfactory visit. We strive to make sure that we do everything with excellence. We have a nation-wide warranty through Goodyear's Tire & Service Network that takes care of all mechanical service that we perform. Could you please call us at 205.664.0810 to help get your problem resolved? Also, I'm sorry you don't see your review. We do not have the ability to remove public reviews. Only Google has that authority. Again, please call us so that we can take care of your matter. Thanks - TW

name: James Davis
text: Was passing through Birmingham when the truck developed a vibration. The staff was wonderful. Told me the problems and the time it would take to fix it. Both were very reasonable and they completed the repairs inside the time given. They even offered to take us to lunch as we were going to be there for several hours.

resp.text:
James Davis,

Thank you very much for the kind and positive review! We love to see that we can make an impact in our customer's lives. Thank you for trusting us. We look forward to taking care of your vehicle again soon if you are ever in the area! Thanks so much! - TW

name: Michele Hayes
text: Excellent service as always! We've been taking all our cars here for years. Paula, Jim, Rick the entire staff are a wonderful.

resp.text:
Michele Hayes,

It has been a pleasure serving you and your family for all of these years! Thank you for sharing such a positive and heart felt review. We strive to make the visit of each of our guests as welcoming as yours! Thank you again and we look forward to taking care of you soon! - TW

name: Quentin Evans
text:
Very nice and helpful staff. My son had a blowout on the highway, and we needed a quick, inexpensive option. Not only did they meet the price mark, but after hearing our situation, they had us out of there in 10 min.

They are now on my short list of tire shops. Excellent job!

resp.text: Quentin Evans, we are greatly appreciative of your five-star review! We are happy that we met your expectations for taking care of your son. As parents ourselves, we know what it is like to make sure that our children are safe and out of harms way. We appreciate the opportunity to take care of your family! Thank you! - TW

name: Emily Clark
text: This location went out of their way to help me when no one else would. Provided quick, friendly service and are true tire professionals! Other tire shops told me it would be 3 days until they could get me a tire, this shop made it happen that day! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Emily Clark, thanks so much for your kind and gracious review of our business! We strive to provide exceptional service for each customer that is in need of assistance. There are many choices to choose from for tire service, but we are happy that we could take care of you! Whenever you visit Birmingham again, you know where you can find auto service! Thanks so much! - TW

name: Nick Casiday
text: The service was high quality, but very slow. I was a walk in with a flat tire, so I expect it to take some time. There were only a couple of people ahead of me and I added an oil change to the patched tire order. It took about 3 hours total. I would suggest using Speedy Tire as an appointment, but not as a walk in.

resp.text: Nick, thank you for the honest review! We will take these measures to the service manager to evaluate. Although, some things may happen out of our control, no matter the case, we strive to make each visit for our customers a pleasant one. Please allow us to take care of you again and to shoot for a five-star experience! Thank you again! - TW

name: Alexandra Smith
text: Friendly and great service. Always available to get me in fast, and understanding of my mood. Of course you never end up at a tire shop when you are having a good day, but they always do whatever they can and suggest the best option.

resp.text: Alexandra, thank you so much for the kind and generous review! We strive to make your visit seamless on each visit. Thank you for trusting us to recommend the best option for you and your vehicle. We look forward to serving you again at the same five-star expectations! Thank you again! - TW

name: Judson Colburn
text: Prices were fair, service was excellent.

resp.text:
James,

Thanks so much for the kind review! We strive to give a five-star experience on each of our guest’s visit! I’m happy that we satisfied your expectations! We look forward to take care of you again! - TW

name: Grant Mavity
text: Took my father in laws car in for a flat tire repair. Was taken care of by manager Paula and owner Thomas Walker. Made me feel like my business even for a flat repair was extremely important to them. You can't go wrong here.

resp.text: Grant Mavity, thank you so much for the gratuitous review! You have many choices of auto service centers to visit, but you chose us! From flat repairs to brake services to engine maintenance, we know that if it wasn't for you we would not be in business! You are very important to us! Thank you for your business and we look forward to serving you again! - TW

name: Steve Hassenplug
text: Jim Paula and Rick have been taking care of my cars for years! Affordable prices and people you can trust. What more could you want?

resp.text:
Steve Hassenplug,

Thank you very much for the generous review! It has been our pleasure to take care of you and your vehicles over the years. You have been a joyous customer and even great advocate of our business. Thank you and we always look forward to take care of you! - TW

name: Amber Butler
text: This the worst place for customer service and care. The female manager in there had 0 compassion for anyone and very rude and offensive clearly in her eyes the customer is never right but she certainly is. I wouldn’t sent my daughters power wheels there to even get touched the other staff was very professional and kind but she has given me the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life and they will NEVER get my business again and I wouldn’t recommend anyone ever using them for anything on your car.

resp.text: Amber Butler, we deeply apologize that you had a poor experience at our location. In the essence of any mistakes that could have been made with your vehicle at our facility, we always ask that you please bring the vehicle to us and not another person or shop. Not only is this for warranty purposes, but because we promise to take care of each and every customer. We strive to be fair and transparent with all recommendations to vehicle problems. I assure you, that our team has discussed this situation immediately. Our team is known for exceptional customer service and we strive to conduct excellence with all customers. We hope that we can be offered another chance to earn your business and trust. Thanks so much! - TW

name: Thomas Hayes
text: Been coming here for years. Buy all my tires for our cars here and also oil changes and maintenance done here. Very helpful staff, Paula, Jim, and Rick.

resp.text: Thomas Hayes, thank you very much for your kind words and review. We greatly appreciate your business over these many years! We look forward to serving you again! Also, thank you for the great pics of our showroom! - TW

name: Patrick strickland
text: Tommy is the best. Not only tells you what's wrong but basically gives you all the knowledge on how to fix it. I don't trust mechanics but this is the only place I take my car.

resp.text: Patrick, thanks so much for the kind review! It's my pleasure to take care of you! Thank you for the loyalty and business throughout the years! I hope that we can continue to serve you in the future to the standards you expect and greater! - TW

name: Ben Hutsler
text: Was disappointed by this place. It was recommended by a friend but both times I went in there, was told about a "problem" I needed to address and went to another place and they said it was not an accurate assessment. I will not be going back.

resp.text:
Ben Hutsler,

We apologize that your visits were not satisfactory. It is the goal of our business to give the best recommendation to solve the issues that you have with your vehicle. We hope that we can be given another chance to earn your business! Thank you! - TW

name: Shawn Price
text: Simply Awsome!  I shopped 4 other pelham area tire shops before I picked Speedy-goodyear.  I know it sounds silly, but they delivered 100% on everything they said they would do.  The tires came in when they said, The work was completed when they said, the spare was rotated out like they said.  The best surprise was the price.  The quote was EXACTLY what I was charged...  no hidden fees, no forgotten taxes, just 100%  accurate... and did NOT include the rebate.  All other stores included the rebates as their "best price"... not speedy, the got all the paperwork together for me and said mail it in you would like some money back from Goodyear.  Just awsome people, I would send my mother to this store.

resp.text:
Shawn Price,

We are greatly appreciative of your five-star review! We are more than appreciate of the story that you shared with us. For that, we are grateful! We look forward to continuing to serve you! And yes! We will take care of your mother's vehicle as well! send her our way! Thanks! - TW

name: Megan Mitchell
text: Phenomenal service and extremely friendly and helpful staff! Just moved to Birmingham area and couldn’t have asked for a better experience.

resp.text: Megan Mitchell, thank you very much for the extremely kind five-star review! We strive to make each of our customer’s experience welcoming and hospitable! We look forward to taking care of you again! Welcome to the Magic City! - TW

name: Rakin Abdullah
text: This place is terrible and I witnessed why before I left my car so it's my fault for dealing with them.I witnessed the front desk argue back and forward with a customer about poor improper work performed on his vehicle this past Saturday but I figured I was only getting an alignment and oil change so what the heck.I left my car key and rim key with the front desk and was told I'd hear from them soon but I never received a call so my wife went down right before closing and they were done.The only key that was returned was my car key and magicallyl the rim key is missing .I call them but they were already closed so I called Monday ,went by Monday and called back Monday after getting the run around from the rude ,unprofessional staff who placed the blame on me and my wife about the key.Did you check your car,her car ,and went on to say they didn't have it or ever received it .The problem wasn't the key it was how we were treated but it was the same treatment I saw them give another customer.PLEASE DONT DO BUSINESS HERE !!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED !!! now I'm changing my work schedule etc to take care of the key problem that they caused and the work that I got on the car is still doing the same thing!

resp.text: Rakin Abdullah, we are very sorry that you encountered this poor experience at our location. Although, we may make mistakes, but we ask that our customers give us the opportunity to make it right to our upmost ability. In the case of the missing wheel lock key, in no way did we attempt to be condescending when asking questions about it's whereabouts. We are only concerned for your belongings. We made every effort to correct the misplacement by checking in the vehicle to purchasing and replacing the wheel lock keys with no hesitation. Your convenience is important to us, so we offered to pick-up and purchase the wheel lock keys for you. Again, we apologize for this inconvenience. Our team has discussed this situation to prevent any encounters such as these again. We strive to provide exceptional customer service for each customer that walks through our doors. We hope that we can be offered another chance to earn your business and trust. Thank you! - TW

name: Kym Klein
text:
Front desk manager, Paula, is one of the rudest and disrespectful customer service managers I've ever encountered!

My windshield wipers had quit working so I pulled in thinking someone could take a quick look at them and let me know what was wrong. When they asked me to come inside and proceeded to try and open a ticket - I said I'm sorry I thought this was something you could help me with so  I turned to walk out.  As I was leaving, Paula rudely snipped, "Do you work for free?"  Her disrespectful comments were totally inappropriate and uncalled for!

I took the vehicle down the street to O'Reilly's and they came out, in the rain,  to check my fuses - FOR FREE!!!

My experience was appalling! No wonder her bays were empty!!!!

resp.text: Kym Klein, we deeply apologize that you had a poor experience at our facility. Although, we must create an invoice for liability purposes for each vehicle that enters our facility, we strive to be fair and transparent with all recommendations for vehicle issues. Please accept my apology for the comments made. Our team has discussed this immediately. Our team is known for exceptional customer service and we strive to display this with each and every customer - no matter the circumstance. We hope that we can be granted another chance to earn your business and trust! Thank you! - TW

name: Michelle Kuznicki
text:
I was heading to Gulf Shores, AL from Hazel Green, AL when my 2014 Jeep took a nosedive in Prattville, AL. After taking it to a Jeep dealership up there, and getting the call that nothing was wrong diagnostically and to come get my vehicle, I started my journey to Gulf Shores once again the next day.

However, about an hour into my drive my Jeep failed again. I chose D and D Automotive at random because I was in the middle of nowhere and had zero clue about my surroundings. I am so glad I did.

After my insurance company got me safely to their shop via tow truck, both Mr. Gary and Joe helped diagnose the issue (it was in fact the alternator), explained the repair to me, checked on me several times (mind you, I was in their shop for close to 6 hours with no where to go), and were incredibly knowledgeable about their trade.

I grew up around cars and can tell pretty quickly when people are in this business to rip off those in need and I can say, without-a-doubt, this shop genuinely cares about their patrons and those they serve. They could have *easily* waited to work on my car the next day but they were immediate in their desire to help and get me back on the road.

I could not be more thankful for their help and cannot recommend them enough. Hearts of gold and quality work, D and D Automotive is the place to go.

resp.text: Michelle, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate the 5 STARS!  We are so glad we would get you back on the road.   We appreciate your business and let us know if we can ever assist you again. Safe travels!

Phenomenal, honest, inexpensive care, they go the extra mile...actually it was closer to ten miles, I was halfway to Greenvile when my idler bearing seized on my Mercedes Benz 350 SLK, shredding my serpentine belt and leaving me properly stranded at Grace Garland exit. Stuck like chuck and the nearest taxi? Montgomery.  Ouch. Gary got the parts to me and got me back up in running in no time, and to say they were fair, well my friend, that is an understatement. Knowledgeable, fast, friendly and trustworthy is what I know about D&D. Hands down they are the absolute best, and in my case saved the day, and what would have been a long cold night on the side of I65. Thank you Gary and D&D, I owe you guys breakfast next time I'm up that way. AAA doesn't hold a candle to D&D 10/10 would not hesitate to use them again or recommend them to anyone, anytime.
John  B Porter
SysAdmin
Airbus Americas Inc
Mobile Engineering  Center

text: Very honest staff. I own a business that could be considered by some to be "competition" since we repair wheels. They are in business to sell wheels. I can't count the times that we have gotten customers because the staff referred them to us. Someone may not know that a wheel can be repaired so they go to them to buy a new one. Instead they will tell them about my company and save their customer money. Some may think that is crazy for them to do but I know that in business that will get you even further.  Most businesses are more concerned with the money now instead of looking at the bigger picture and knowing that doing right by the customer will ultimately make you more in the end! Keep up the great work guys!

name: Skip Smith
text: I'm a big believer in trying to support local businesses, especially "Mom & Pop" small business owners such as Landers. But they have to do their part and Landers was a BIG FAIL! I needed 2 new wheels and tires, and despite telling them to go ahead and upcharge me for overnight delivery, they ordered replacement wheels with normal delivery... and when the wheels arrived, they had ordered the wrong wheels! But the most egregious act was promising to call me and then closing up shop and not calling me and notifying me of their mistake, and keeping my car over the weekend with no notification. Ultimately took my car to the dealership and they did in less than 36 hours what Landers could not do in a week. NEVER, EVER AGAIN! ----- Response to Owner's Reply: Potential customers here should be advised - The owner misrepresents the facts in this matter. I was the one who contacted them on Friday morning (car had been delivered Monday afternoon from Walmart because replacement wheels for that vehicle were not in their supply chain - not because Walmart "was not good enough" per the business owners implication) and was told by Shannon (co-owner) that my wheels were in Oxford per the tracking label. I then questioned that "if the tracking info shows the wheels still in Oxford, they probably would not be delivered today". She then stated "No, they are out for delivery". Now comes the most salient point - I then requested that she call me THAT DAY (Friday) to 1) to let me know when the wheels came in and 2) to let me know when I may expect to pick my car up that evening, or if not, when I may expect it. I never received a phone call, and when I went to their business to check on my car at 4:30pm, they had closed early (Their hours of operation state 8:30am - 5:00pm). I think the lesson for potential customers in this from both my experience and the owners acerbic response to a critical but legitimate review is simply this - "CAVEAT EMPTOR" ("Let the buyer beware").

resp.text: Sorry that you feel this way, but let's start out with the truth. You were called Friday and you were informed the wheels hadn't arrived and I told you it would be Monday. I also explained the whole overnight thing with you and you were fine with it. And I ordered the correct wheels, but unfortunately they sent me the wrong ones. I told you I would get the right ones in, but that was not good enough for you sir. You had your car at Wal-Mart before you called me and they were not good enough for you either. In fact that's why you had the car towed in to me. I can only hope that you didn't talk to them like you did me. We do not live in a perfect world , and all I can do is treat you with respect and try to help you the in the best way I can. But please just tell the truth about people and always treat them the way you want to be treated. Kindness always brings happiness!!!!! Have a great day.

name: C B
text:
1 Year Later Edit:
Still love this tire shop.  Editing my review from last year because at the time I said "Don't expect a shiny showroom floor with fancy tire displays and brochures.  The office is full of tires--it's a small shop and not much room to store them anywhere else I suppose."  This is no longer true.  They remodeled the interior of their shop, moved the tires somewhere else and really cleaned the place up.  Definitely more inviting inside.  Don't want anyone to be put off by my original review stating that the office was crowded and full of tires--it's now clean, shiny and even features a few tire displays.

What you can always expect is great prices, friendly, and prompt service.  It's a mom and pop type shop, which appeals to me vs the big chains.  Also, since they are not a big chain, they are hardly ever busy.  It's rarely taken more than a few minutes for anything I've had done there--four new tires mounted and balanced and out the door in the time it would take most tire shops to even get your car on a lift.

You won't beat their price on the tires or installation.  Once I found them, it's the only place I go.  Definitely recommend.

resp.text:
Thank you sir i'm glad you like our upgrades. we are continuously trying to make it as family friendly as possibly.

P.S. we have upgraded to Road Force Balancing now also.

text:
Short: Prompt, very reasonable, and friendly.
Long: Driving back from the beach, my wife, two kids (under 2), and I got a low tire pressure warning. We called a few places on our route, and Nick's was kind said they could look at it right away. They had a bay waiting on us when we arrived. The kids stayed in the car and never woke up. In and out in 20 minutes and they did not take advantage of having a captive audience, very reasonable price. I can't thank the folks at Nick's enough for their friendly, prompt, and financially reasonable service. I highly recommend if you're close to Florala and in need of tire or auto service.

text: Has good work ethic and good communication skills he doesn't stop until  the job is complete!!

name: Chad Smith
text: I called because our travel trailer had a broken axle.  What a responsive group of people and so very kind.  We are still waiting on some parts to come in from Dexter, but they have been nothing but wonderful so far.  Great there are such good people still on this earth.

name: Larry White
text: Came out in a timely manner, saved me from having to get a tow truck when they have tow trucks. Didn’t just fix the problem, but also adjusted my trailer brakes bcuz he saw an axle sticking with no charge. Looked over my truck and found other problems as well. Worked all day until 4 am trying to fix my truck bcuz my driver was under a load. Checked my boxes and saw they both was low in gear oil. Topped them off and told me I had a yoke seal leak and a drive axle leak. Didn’t charge me for the oil he put in my truck. Cut down the price so I could get everything fixed bcuz he didn’t want me having problems down on the road. Sent pictures of all the malfunctioning parts and sent pictures of the new parts once installed. Called and texted the next day to make sure everything was going fine. Charged me less than what I would’ve got charged anywhere else knowingly bcuz my money was funny due to me just paying  to get my motor rebuilt by another mechanic. Told me the other problems I needed to get done in the future. I know honest mechanics are hard to come by but I have been blessed to find one and will continue doing business with this knowledgeable and honest family owned mechanic shop.  Thanks Adam!

name: Katrena Mills
text:
Family Owned
Great service
Great prices

The next morning the car was fixed and they picked us up. All at a reasonable price. Very nice people and very helpful. Our thanks to everyone at Tigerstate.

name: Michael Walton
text: These guys are awesome! Had a catastrophic wheel failure while towing a trailer at about 11 PM in the rain. These guys came and towed both my truck and trailer to their shop quickly and professionally. They were going to take me to a hotel for the night but when they asked where I was headed and found out I had a plane to catch the next day to see family they immediately got work on my vehicle (it was almost midnight at this point). They found enough lug nuts to fit my oversized Land Rover wheels and got me back on the road that night! Top notch service and some genuinely good people. Recommend highly!

I was having trailer issues on the way to Louisiana and these nice folks were able to help me out even though the tech was already up most of the night and had little sleep.

I was extremely pleased with their politeness and service!

name: Nathan Barber
text: Adam stayed with us until 2:30 am repairing our trailer to ensure we were ready for the road again. Truly great service!

name: Ididodi Ididodi
text: If your truck break in the area you can consider yourself lucky. Family owned business, honest  people and fair prices.

name: Dale Kiddy
text:
Just want to say that you will never find a better group of people than the family of Tigerstate Truck and Trailer.  After being left broke down on the shoulder of the road by another repair company.  Adam,  William and Holly went the extra mile to get my truck and trailer towed to their location and helped me secure a motel for the night.  The next morning they picked me up and to the shop so  another driver could continue with the load. (This was a Sunday morning). Adam did a check of the truck and found it was a transmission failure . They made sure that I had a room for Sunday .
On Monday they went over 100 miles each way to get a transmission and other parts and had me back on the road at a very reasonable price on Tuesday.
This is a family owned company and very professional and I would highly recommend them.  If you need anything stop by and Jo ,Holly, Adam and William and have a cup of coffee.

text: The good folks at Mavis Tire & Brake on Pelham Pkwy are friendly, knowledgeable, and honest. I had 4 new Pirelli's put on my new/used sports car and before they installed them I was shown my brakes & rotors. The rotors had heat damage and the pads were almost to metal. It was very disheartening until they quoted a price and than they further included coupons and discounts bringing my grand total to a  better than reasonable cost for everything, including an oil change!! From now on I'm bringing all my vehicles to Mavis and have already got service & tires for a friend. I'll be referring them to all my family & friends from now on! Great job Mavis!!!👍🏻

name: Larissa Baker
text: Went in for the $99 on front brakes and $99 on rear brakes, $200 total. Was told my rotors needed changing. I'm not sure if they did or didn't, but the $200 visit turned into almost $700. Not sure if the rotors could've been turned. What I'm most upset is there was some ammo missing out of my vehicle after my visit. No one else, other than myself, had been in my vehicle. It wasn't visible and would've had to be deliberately stolen. Can't prove it, but this was only place that had access to the inside of my vehicle. Won't be back for my suspicions as well as the conversations that day in the shop regarding ammo, finding ammo, etc.

resp.text: We apologize, Larissa. We believe accountability is paramount. We truly apologize that there was a discrepancy with the pricing during your visit. When you can, please contact our consumer solutions department at 914-984-2500 option #2 and we would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you.

name: Phillip Smart
text:
On may 9th 2020  I purchased tires from the Mavis on Highway 31 in Pelham. I went with the discount tires, because the last set I got from a Mavis ( trussville AL) lasted a decent amount of time mileage wise.
Here is my list of grievances
1. About two weeks later, I noticed one of the lug nuts was almost falling off. One round and it would have been off on the ground .This infuriates me even more, because I specifically instructed the technician to make sure I could get the lugs off with a regular lug wrench, as I do my own tire rotation and oil change every 5-7.5k. Three of the lugs were so tight I had to stand on the hands. Again, one was falling off, three were almost impossible to remove.
2. of course I got talked into the 89$ alignment
3. Its not my vehicle ( wife ), so it took me a couple of weeks to notice the bad vibration at 70mph, so back to the shop to get tires re balanced, which I already pay 75$ for. I did not go back to the Mavis because I don't trust them. They couldn't even tighten my lugs
4. When I get to the new tire place, I find out that all of my tires are set to 41 psi. 41!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Now the tires are cupping, which means they will need to be replaced soon.
5. One of the tires was out of balance

They were super quick to get an alignment and do it, but they couldn't even get my lugs on and get the tire pressure right?
This place is an embarrassment.

resp.text: We apologize, Phillip, We at Mavis believe you deserve nothing short of the best. We're so sorry for your experience. Your feedback is truly valued. You're right Phillip and we need to do better than this for you. Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can have the opportunity to talk to you!

name: Nick Lions
text: I picked my tires on their website July 15th and scheduled install on July 19th at 9am. I ordered the 3rd set of tires down the list that were recommended for my vehicle (2017 Ford Transit 250), Michelin Defender T+H. I work 6-7 days a week as a contractor so Sunday was really my only option to get tires on my work vehicle. I arrived early for my appointment, confirmed my appointment, and confirmed the tires with the employee behind the sales counter. I confirmed that the tires I ordered will be the best fit for my vehicle with the employee and he said they will be great for it. So my wife picked me up and we went about our day. I received a phone call at 11:18 informing me the tires are installed on my vehicle but they’re not going to work then proceeded to tell me they can order the correct tires for it but they won’t be here till Tuesday July 21st. I explained I can’t just leave my vehicle up there not working for 2 days, and asked if they can just put my old tires back on the van. The employee responded with yes but we will have to charge you for mount and balance, my only request was to install the tires with the best tread on the rear which he agreed to. I received a second call at 4:10 stating my vehicle was ready but that they close at 5 and needed to be there before 5 to pick it up. I arrived paid the clerk $75.96, received my keys, walked out to my truck to find my tires low, tire light on and the rear tires (almost bald) on the passenger side and the front tires (still had a good amount of tread on them) on the drivers side which was not what I asked. I asked if they could add some air to my tires and get my tire light to turn off. They did add air to my tires but when I asked about the tire light the manager had to stop putting Alabama stickers on his truck brought a computer tpms sensor out and showed me very quickly the tire pressure was fine and told me this would be expected with used tires... My tire light never went off like he said it would. Today is July 29th and I have yet to receive a phone call stating my tires have arrived or a update. I emailed Mavis corporate on July 23rd and have not received a response or anything. Never once did anyone apologize for the inconvenience that this mishap caused me that was clearly Mavis Tires fault and caused me to pay for their mistake. I at no point complained or expressed any frustration to the employees there because I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. I don’t ever leave bad reviews for businesses because I know what that can do to a business, but I did want to take a minute and send you a email about my experience. I ended up purchasing a set of tires from Discount Tires on Hwy 280 and it was a great experience. I called them in the morning they called me as soon as the tires arrived, and installed them the same day in less then 1 hour after leaving my vehicle with them. Upon arrival there was no tire light on and the tires had the proper amount of air in them. I hope this email helps in one way or form, I’m not complaining but just find it hard to understand why Mavis Discount tire would charge a customer any amount of money for a issue/mistake on their end.

resp.text: We're sorry, Nick Lions. we apologize your appointment time was not honored. Please call us at 914-984-2500 option #2 so we can have the opportunity to talk to you!

text: Had a simple oil change done at this location got home and noticed oil pouring out of my car. Brought back to the store for them to fix. The shop manager said they left off the rubber seal on the filter. The amount of oil that leaked all over my motor was over a quart. They fixed the problem but didn’t clean all the excess oil from the motor so i still have oil dripping on my driveway.  I’m guess it the leftover oil because they said it couldn’t be anything else or it must be a leak somewhere else. I said the car wasn’t leaking when I brought it. They lost my business from this point on if you’re mechanic can’t do a simple oil change without checking it for leaks. Now i have a car with oil leak. Will probably have to take it somewhere else and have it fixed since they messed it up.  Good place for tires just don’t have anything else done here!

text: I give this company zero stars, it just wouldn't allow me to post without marking at least one star. We called around to various tire stores to compare prices. The man at Mavis Tires told us we could get two new tires, plus have the front tires moved to the back and everything balanced at an all in price with everything we needed at $224. We specifically asked if that included tax and were told it did. We made an appointment. When we arrived today for the appointment, the man at the register told us it would be $259, which is much higher than we were quoted originally and from other tire stores. We told him that we had been quoted $224 including product, labor and taxes, and he said no it's $259.  We feel like we were victims of a bait and switch. We chose not to accept the new price, and we left. We will never go to this business again.

The reason I like this company is because they are fast and good with oil changes and tire rotations.

name: Leslie Kirk
text:
I had a slow leak in a tire (that developed into a not so slow leak) that I had brought to the attention of where I usually have my oil changed and tires rotated. They didn't find anything. I came to Tire Engineers because of a positive experience a few years back. I would say within 15 minutes (or less) of my arrival, the problem had been found and was on it's way to being fixed (it was a drywall screw in the tread). While waiting, the gentleman that checked me also discussed the life expectancy of my tires (he did not try to sell me anything). We also had a very nice conversation about what sounds like great place to eat in Louisiana.

Yes, it was a very nice experience.

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

name: Joshua Kirts
text: I was stranded on the interstate with my wife and one year old daughter in the blistering heat in desperate need of help (hundreds of miles from home); I had a flat tire and when I pulled the spare from the trunk, it too was also flat.  A man pulled up asking if I needed help, I told him what was going on and he said that he would take the tire, that initially caused us to be stranded, and repair it at his place of employment (THE CHANGE) and bring it right back.  After returning with my repaired tire I tried to give him money, he refused, I tried to convince him to take the money, but he still refused.  Really the only request he had was to pray with him; therefore, my family and an additional driver that pulled over to help prayed with this unknown man on the side of the interstate.  All I know is that this man worked for "THE CHANGE".....The moral of this story is we live in a time where ethics are not always important to the standard employee, and with vehicles becoming more and more difficult to work on, we rely on mechanics and businesses to be honest.  If "THE CHANGE" hires other employees like this unknown man, I would be a customer for life.

As a result, we googled nearby auto-mechanic shops and Jac's Tire & Auto Care came up. We looked at the reviews and there were numerous good critiques. Seeing the positive reviews, we decided to take our car there; we do not regret it at all. The mechanic fixed our car with no problem and it did not take long at all. It was nearing the holiday season and the mechanic was busy, however, he still knew our urgency and how we needed to get our car fixed and quickly get home. He prioritized our car and repaired it flawlessly. Everyone there was incredibly friendly and kind. I recommend Jac's Tire & Auto Care shop whenever you need to get your car repaired.

resp.text: James, we hate to hear that you were not satisfied. R&O is under new ownership now and I hope you will come by and let us make things right if we can.

name: André Garcia
text:
It's ok for the price.  However the reason they don't get the extra 3 stars is because they are always trying to sell you stuff you don't need, which is why I stooped coming back to this place before. Decided to give it a try and it was the same think.

The service guy called me in the garage to show me "something on my car".  He had the air filter open and he pointed to it and pointed to my EXHAUST MANIFOLD and told me that my injectors and inside "there" was full of  "gunk" and that I needed a fuel injector cleaning for $59.   FIRST, the fuel injectors are NOT inside the EXHAUST MANIFOLD or the air filter.  Second, unless you took apart my valve cover you HAVE NO IDEA how clean/dirty my injectors are.  My car is fairly new which quite low mileage and very well maintained,  don't try to scam me into something that I DON'T need,  or even if I did you wouldn't know simply by pointing to my Exhaust Manifold.

There is a good reason the place across the street "Firestone" was packed with people and they are more expansive and this place was empty.  It's called HONESTY.

resp.text:
Dear André,
We are sorry your last visit to our auto shop did not meet your expectations. Our staff is well trained to identify maintenance issues on each vehicle we diagnose. We are a family owned honest, friendly, and affordable auto maintenance shop. We'd greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss your concerns further, in hopes of reaching a positive resolution. Please contact one of the owners at your earliest convenience, in hopes of making this right with you. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham
(205) 637-5523

name: Jade Howlet
text: I never had an experience so BAD! I get my tires rotated and oil changed. I come back to get the same services done. The mechanic tells me whoever rotated my tires last stripped my lug nut post. When they realize they were the ones who did it they tell me I need to sign a waiver for them to try to fix it or pay for a whole new post! I will never be back!

resp.text:
Dear Jade,
We really appreciate our customers and continuously strive to provide excellent customer service. Our records do not show you as a client of ours. Is there a possibility the transaction is under a different name? We are happy to discuss any issues you might have with your vehicle and try to reach a reasonable solution.
Please give us a call at (205) 637-5523 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Trent Daniels
text: Front desk lady was very nice. The gentleman working on my truck was very informative. I always come here for an oil change, doesnt take long at all. You cant beat these prices

resp.text:
Dear Trent,
We wanted to say a big "thanks" for your nice review. We will certainly pass along the compliments to our staff. We enjoy taking great care of our customers by delivering affordable pricing and efficient services. Customers like you make our jobs rewarding and enjoyable. Thank you!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Justin McClew
text: Nice people that don't do nice work. Took it for the premium oil change. Told me all the belts and hoses looked good, air filter was good everything is topped off, but my radiator was leaking. Soon as I left there was a big vibration in it... Let the car sit for 3days, both radiator hoses needed to be replaced, leaking because of corrosion, the air filter was horrible, the pcv valve was clogged, power steering that doesn't leak was empty and the vibration was because they put 2 quarts more oil than the engine was supposed to have!! Quoted me a price to get a radiator when it was a hose they told me was good!

name: monica mitchell
text: I am sitting here now for the third time since a tune up and oil change last week. As soon as I drive off I noticed my car was missing in a cylinder. Had to come back and get a coil replaced immediately. Also my power steering fluid was extremely low and my coolant level was low. once again drove off and noticed oil burning. I couldn't come right back but came back a few days later and it was the plug gasket. So either it wasn't checked when the oil was drained or the tightest plug too tight. Once again even left after gasket replace and car is still burning oil. Now it smokes too. Telling me it's the axle boot which is messed up but none of this began until immediately after I've left from getting service done here. I'm so disappointed because the last time I was here I had such a good experience I thought I had found my new spot to get work done on my car.

resp.text:
Dear Monica,
We are very sorry you are experiencing auto issues. We have checked our records and our auto center does not show the name used on the review as a customer at our auto shop. We would like to assist you in finding a positive resolution and ask that you give one of us a call at the number shown below. We are happy to talk with you at your earliest convenience. Thanks so much!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

(205) 637-5523

text: Ive heard this location has been shut down but ive been here recently, great service

Hello Drew,
Your patronage at our auto center is greatly appreciated. Thanks for the compliment on our auto services.

You are correct, we have closed this location and plan to relocate about 25 miles away close to Finley Avenue and Farmers Market. We also have a Precision Tune Auto Care center in Alabaster, which is only 6 miles away from our old Pelham shop.

We hope to see you again so we can continue providing you with excellent auto maintenance services. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: D F
text: They test the cars they service by flying up and down hilltop business dr as fast as they can.

resp.text:
Dear Drew,
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We too have noticed that there seems to be a lot of vehicles driving faster than they should on Hilltop Drive. Please know that we have addressed this concern with  our employees and have emphasized how important it is to follow the speed limit at all times. Safety is our number one concern in our shop, and also as we test drive any vehicles. If you have any additional questions, or concerns, please feel free to call the store manager, Kevin Gainey, at (205) 637-5523. Thank you very much!

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text: I WAS a long time client until this weekend when they over charged us (found out too late after spending over $650!!) & my husband gave them instructions to leave our car locked outside of their shop, for us to pick up, since we couldn't come until after they were closed. Not only was our car not outside for us, it was still on the rack with the hood up in the shop!! We had to back track to our house & my husband was late for his job! We are VERY disappointed. We have literally spent thousands there through the years. And we are done.

name: Jennifer Cargile
text:
My husband went in with his CRV on a Saturday about 9am for a normal oil change and a check engine light, was told that he needed some spark plugs and new oil pan gasket (there were NO oil leaks that we had noticed, and we were told it was loosing 80% of its oil) and was told it wouldn't take long at all, maybe an hour,  well he didn't leave until after 12 (receipt said 1217). He asked multiple times if it was ready, was told only 20 more mins, then 30...well 2 hours after the said time he left. We had plans at 11am, so those didn't happen WHICH could have been planned for-like loading up my kids (one being a newborn) in the car and picking him up. No apologies for the extra wait time and never honest about how long it was going to take.
Come that following week, SURPRISE, there was an oil leak on the garage floor AND the check engine light was back on. So we took it back once again. He was told that it was just old oil coming out and it was fine and that some other piece needed to be replaced for the check engine light. Like why wasn't this fixed the first time!? Unless we got super unlucky and something went wrong within the 3/4 day time.

Well now it's about 4 months later and there's still oil spots on the floor!
So we called today, I got a so-so person on the phone and was told to bring it back in, no "oh my goodness! That's not what we like to hear..please bring it back in!" It was just "bring it back".

1st, can we make the comparison on the comment from Ashton Morgan below?? This was the SAME day, the SAME time and my husband remembers talking and waiting with Ashton.
We aren't very knowledgable on car repairs and we should've gotten a 2nd opinion(the Garage in Pelham is literally walking distance and everyone always has great things to say about them, but this was just for a cheap oil change-never again!) ..but we just had a baby and didn't have much spare time or sleep to decide these things with a clear mind.

I just reccomend going somewhere else for piece of mind EVEN for an oil change, even if this was just a random bad day (which look at the rating-use your brains people! We didn't and now we're paying for it with our time and now a nasty driveway and garage floor) for the people working on cars, there has yet to be a verbal apology-and now if we get one it will just seem forced.

resp.text:
Dear Jennifer,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham. We wanted to apologize for the long wait during your last visit with us. We know our customers time is valuable and we always strive to provide a reasonable time estimate on each service we perform. I can assure you we addressed the waiting issue and are thrilled to have a new store manager.

Our records show we serviced your vehicle in early February 2016. We offer a 12-month warranty on all services and encourage you to contact us at (205) 637-5523 to set up a follow-up appointment. Since your vehicle has over 189,000 miles on it, there may be another leak requiring some attention. We look forward to making this right with you. Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing our auto shop for your recent oil change, Ms. Thompson. We love our customers and appreciate your business very much. We look forward to seeing you again for any of your other car care needs.  ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Richard Cosby
text: I bought two tires, paid $90.00, drove about 3 miles noticed a roar ( unusual loud noise) in one of the tires. I came back and informed the manager of the situation. He replied that because I picked my own tires it would cost me $15.00 to exchange the tire. Please note that the tires that I picked were from the ones they had for sale.  I declined and informed him that this was very unfair and I would never come back or recommend anybody else to buy tires from your business. The very next morning the pressure was low in both tires and they leak down every other day.  For a business or businessman this is totally unacceptable, and I plan to get some satisfaction.  I am feel very strong that others have experienced the same thing and this is not an isolated case.  I would like very much for someone in upper management to give me a call.

name: Ken Klispie
text: Excellent service! The team at Guthrie's did a thorough inspection of our new/used minivan after it started making various intermittent sounds from a long cross country drive. They were able to pinpoint several issues that were small but would have left us stranded on our next big trip. Quick, very reasonable and communicative through the repairs. We did our next long trip without any issues or noises. We know where we will be taking all of our cars for service, thank you!

resp.text: Thank you, Ken for the review. We appreciate your business. We are happy to help with your automotive needs. Welcome to Alabama!!!

name: Steven Richardson
text: We were traveling through Alabama and my pickup broke down right off the 310 Cullom exit. The tow truck driver recommended Guthrie.  We were nervous not knowing anyone but were pleasantly surprised. We received text updates and a phone call to explain what needed to be done.  They exceeded our expectation completing the job quickly and at a fair price. Highly recommend their auto shop. God Bless.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Steven. We appreciate your kind words. We always try to get people back on the road. I know what it is like to be broken down on the road. Especially if you are on a schedule. Thank you so much for choosing Guthrie's Auto Service.

name: Michael Blair
text: Our car started experiencing some pretty severe issues on our drive home to Tennessee from Florida. We genuinely could not have chosen a better exit to pull over at! We pulled Guthrie's Auto up on our Maps and decided to take our car over there. Despite how busy they were, they were very understanding that we were from out of town and immediately got to work on our vehicle and offered recommendations on places to eat around since we had to wait several hours! Absolutely awesome service!

resp.text: We appreciate your words, and the 5 stars. We strive to give everyone a 5 star experience and help them along their way. Thanks again. Terry Guthrie

resp.text: Thank you Victor, we appreciate your business. Terry

text: Great people. Keep you updated on progress and prices. Very trustworthy.

resp.text: Thank you Teresa, we appreciate your business and kind words. Terry

name: Barbara
text:
A Great Place/Great People... Our truck broke down & Triple A couldn’t have found a better place to take it to! They took us to our hotel & picked us back up....The owner went above & beyond to get our truck fixed so we could be back on the road this morning! Truck is running great again! Thank You So much for not only getting our truck fixed but for your kind & thoughtfulness.
Rick, Barbara & LACI

resp.text: It was a pleasure to meet you two. I was happy to help you all with your F-250 diesel. Glad you were able to get back on the road any get out of the flooding that we had that day. We were safe but got a lot of rain that day. Thanks again for letting us to serve you.

text: They got my car fixed in no time flat. The cost was super reasonable. And it’s been several weeks everything is running perfectly. I would highly recommend Terry and his crew!!

resp.text: Janice, thank you for your review! We're glad we could provide a quality auto repair service for you and we'll see you soon!

name: La Donna Griffin
text: I received very good service, both times I brought my car to Guthrie's.  Very nice employees., and patient with the questions I ask.  I'll be back.  I've recommended Guthrie's to a few people.

resp.text: Thank you La Donna for the 4 stars. We hoped to give you a 5 star experience when we serviced your Kia. Maybe next time. We do appreciate you trusting us with your vehicle. Terry Guthrie

name: Page Sparks
text: A couple years ago my car was really in a bad way, and took it to the dealership. They were going to charge me $1500 for my repair. I despaired and reached out to friends and family for recommendations. A good friend recommended Guthrie's, said they always did good work. So I called them up. For the same repair they were going to have to charge close to $900. It was better but still hurt. Took my car up and waited. Got a call from Mike and he said that he wanted to check over the car before I spent all that money. He discovered what the dealership didn't, that something was just unplugged. Only charged the diagnostic fee! He could have charged me fully, but he and this business have been ethical. I take my car to them anytime I have issues, and they've been precise and sure every time. Would highly recommend for anyone who's been burned by bad mechanics.

resp.text: Page, thank you for your review. We were happy to have been able to help you out with your vehicle and to save you money. We appreciate having you as a customer and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Hustle Hard Fitness
text: Very caring and reliable crew Terry and them have always took care of our car needs and always does a fantastic job! Great prices and they get it done it a timely manner

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review! We'll continue to provide a caring and reliable atmosphere for your auto repair needs and we look forward to helping you in the future!

name: Felicia Wright
text: Took my vehicle to have my AC looked at. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. Seemed to want to help me more than just make a dollar. They have a text system set up that notifies you when your vehicle is being worked on. The owner follows up with you a day or so after you pick up your vehicle to be sure everything is going well. Very personable business.

resp.text: Felicia, thank you for your review! We're happy to have looked at your A/C and we'll continue to be friendly and knowledgeable.

name: John Thomas
text: Broke down while traveling. They was very helpful and willing to get our truck repaired at very reasonable rates. I highly recommend Guthrie's Auto Service.

resp.text: John, thank you for your review, we hope you had safe traveling after visiting our auto repair shop, and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: Bettie Burnett
text: Had car towed to Guthrie's for repair on coolant system. Had been told by two regular customers that they do really good work. The office attendant (Mike, I think was his name), was straight-forward, respectful, patient, gave me a phone quote, had the work done timely, with the final bill ending up being a little less than the original quote, even after adding the tow bill & taxes. It was a very welcomed change from the experience I'd had at another local shop I'd been referred to (but later warned about from several other past customers) where I repeatedly had to endure rudeness from the know-it-all mechanic, immediate breakdowns from same issue I'd just paid to have repaired, & ignored voicemails asking to speak to the owner. Guthrie's owner followed-up the very next day to make sure everything was going well with the work on my car. I would much rather pay for a job well done the first time than a little less and keep breaking down, having my car towed, finding another way to work at the last minute to keep my job, and then constantly being talked down to in person & over the phone (while the owner justifies it as him "being from New York",... to which I reminded them both that he's now n ALABAMA, & that cocky attitude won't do here, especially with me!!... 3 different types of repairs... never fixed after being told they were!). So, yes, I am very happy to give Guthrie's a positive review, THANK YOU!

resp.text: Bettie, thank you for your review. We were happy to help out with your coolant system repair and we are glad to be respectful, honest, and patient for all of our customers. We are sorry you had a bad experience at a different shop, but thank you for trusting us to get the job done. See you later!

name: Randy Anderson
text: Took my '08 Tundra in for some pretty major repairs (stuck secondary air intake valve, timing belt replacement, pulley repair). I’m beyond pleased with the quality of the work, the affordable price, and the speed of service you guys gave me. I’m new to the area, and will be coming back to you guys for any vehicle work that I need, and I’ll make sure to tell everyone else I meet about you as well! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Randy! We're glad we could help you out with your '08 Tundra repairs, and we'll continue to offer quality and affordable auto repair services, and we are excited to have you as our customer. See you next time!

name: hotrodford 88
text: Great people to deal with.

name: Jeffrey Stevens
text: They were AAA approved brought truck in for water pump replacement they repaired it in a timely manner and did a over all inspection people were very friendly

resp.text: Jeffrey, thank you for your leaving us a review. We're glad to have helped you out and let us know if there anything we can do for you!

name: Cheryl Masterson
text: I was traveling thru Cullman car wouldn't start.  They repaired it same day. What a blessing, excellent service.

resp.text: Cheryl, we're so glad we could help you out while you were traveling through Cullman. Thank you for trusting us with your auto repair needs!

name: Mark Maddox
text: My truck needed help. I planned on it being in the shop for 7 to 10 days. I dropped it off on a Monday afternoon, and received a call on Friday afternoon that it was ready. Never did I think anyone could repair or replace as many things as Guthrie's did in such a short time. I left Guthrie's and drove to Gulf Shores. The true test, interstate highway's in Alabama. They did a great job. No vibration, shaking, or leaking. Awesome job guys. Thanks.

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Here at Guthrie's Auto Service, we understand how important your vehicle is to you. That is why we always strive to provide quality care in a timely manner. It was a pleasure to work on your truck and we're thrilled to hear that your drive to Gulf Shores was smooth. We look forward to your next visit!

name: Jason Bookout
text: We were from out of town and our car broke down late on a Friday afternoon. Terry the owner fixed our busted coolant hose and had us back on the road in less than 2 hours for a fair price. He did not take advantage of a situation where we had no other choice.  I have later heard from other friends in the area that Terry does great work. Would highly recommend if you are in the area.

resp.text: Jason, we appreciate your kind review and were happy to assist with your coolant hose. We understand how frustrating it can be to deal with vehicle issues when you are out of town, so we were glad we could fix it quickly so you can be on your way. Thank you and please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you in the future!

name: tanya roberson
text: Very courteous, professional, high quality service! They solved our overheating issue and fixed it Fast! Highly recommend!! Best auto service in Cullman!!

resp.text: Tanya, thank you for your review! We're excited to continue to be courteous, professional, and provide high quality service! Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Xochitl Robinson
text: Terry was very helpful and pleasant.I went there to have an stimate on a problem that I have in my SUV. The place is very clean.prices are reasonable. Thanks Terry.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We appreciate your support of our auto repair shop!

name: Justin Nichols
text: Needed help tracking a power draw draining my battery, they found it and got everything sorted very quickly. I was very pleased with the service and I will absolutely use them for future repairs.

resp.text: Justin, thank you for your review! We're glad we could be here to help with your battery, and we'll look forward to seeing you next time in our auto repair shop!

name: Douglas Ballenger
text:
I was really surprised by the service and friendliness of Guthries auto service, after I spent 2 weeks working on my vehicle with no luck finding the problem I decided to find a shop to work on it. A friend of mine recommended Guthries. Some of problems I was having with my vehicle was, lost power to all of my windows, lost power to my rear view mirror and backup camera, blown bulb in taillights, short causing battery to drain, could not turn ignition switch All the way off so I couldn’t get key out 🤔😂 but the power door lock still worked!!
But don’t lock them if you have something draining your battery ! 🙃 Seriously Guthries will be my go to from now on ! Very friendly service, very knowledgeable and very fair service pricing!! I’m not going to say what my vehicle problem was ask Mike when you take your vehicle 🚗 in.

To all at Guthries auto service,

Thank you 🙏

resp.text: Douglas, we appreciate your kind review. We were more than happy to help you out of a tricky situation with your vehicle, and we'll continue to be friendly, knowledgeable, and fair-priced for your future visits. Thank you and we'll see you again!

name: Marie Lindsey
text: Great service and repairs. Called me as they found issues and got my approval before all repairs. Even checked with me the next day to make sure everything was working. I will take my other vehicles there for any service or repairs. Very satisfied customer!

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback, Marie! Our goal is to provide quality repairs to all of our customers along with excellent communication to keep our customers in the loop. We look forward to working with you again in the future.

name: Emily Taylor
text: I've used this shop for a number of repairs on my older vehicle now. Their prices are fair, the staff are all friendly and knowledgeable, and they are very expedient! I never have to wait long when I call, they're usually able to schedule my repair for the same week, and they always complete my repair in less time than expected.  They also send valuable customer loyalty coupons!

resp.text: Emily, we are glad to have you as a customer in our shop. We will continue to offer fair prices, friendly and quality service, and timely. We look forward to your next visit to our shop!

name: Gregg Loney
text: Long story as short as possible! I’m driving from Orlando to Las Vegas with a car load and 3 pets. I drove in with my car acting up and they went right to work. They kept me updated with the progress and about 2 days later I had my car back in perfect working ordering! I have no idea what this kind of work is worth with parts and labor but having peace of mind is worth it all.

resp.text: Gregg, we are so happy that we were able to get you back on the road quickly in a vehicle that will get you to your destination! Providing our great customers the peace of mind to travel cross-country is so important to us!

name: Paw Paw John
text: Guthrie's Auto Service is very reliable, honest and friendly. They always called for approval with a price quote before performing any work. I highly recommend Terry and his crew for all of your auto service needs.

resp.text: We appreciate the 5-star review and we are glad to be reliable, honest, and friendly. We look forward to having you back in our auto repair shop!

name: Rachel Dawsey
text: Guthrie's Auto is great to work with!  They keep our cars running and are very personable and friendly!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Rachel! We are glad to have you as a customer, and we'll continue to be here for your automotive repair needs while being friendly and professional.

name: Joe Cook
text: Guthrie’s Auto Service is the only service center I trust with servicing my vehicles. They are dependable,  thorough and reasonably priced. Terry and his team definitely know their stuff.

resp.text: Joe, thank you for your review. We're happy we have earned your trust for all of your automotive repair needs. We will continue to be dependable, thorough, and reasonably priced and we look forward to your next visit!

name: Phyllis Hain
text: We have been using Guthrie's for over two years to take care of our import cars and my old Mountaineer.  They have done a great job and have stood behind their work.  We appreciate their professional service and highly recommend their team -- both Terry and Mike offer knowledgeable  assistance.

resp.text: Thank you Phyllis for your continued loyalty with us! We are so glad that we can continually provide your cars with the services they need and provide you with  knowledge and comfort regarding your services! Thanks again and see you next time!

name: Jane Brannon
text: Always prompt with service. Fair and friendly service. Only place I go for auto repair.

resp.text: Jane, thank you for your review! We'll continue to be fair and friendly, and we look forward to your next visit!

name: Jason Teichmiller
text: Terry is a great guy who has been is business for a long time.  My dad trusted him with all of our automotive repair needs and I trust him now.  I have always found him to be honest and dependable.

resp.text: Thank you Jason! We're happy to have had your family as customers and will continue to provide great customer service when it comes to our automotive repair for you! Thank you for trusting us.

name: LT Chris_Al
text: I called and scheduled an appointment on a Wednesday for a that Friday.  I had never been in before as I haven’t lived in Cullman long. The guy at the front took my info and they had my car in within a few minutes. I was expecting to leave it there for the day and had a friend on their way to pick me up.  My car was ready before they got there. (A/C leak). Two days later I get a text from the manager following up to make sure I was satisfied and to make sure the A/C was working properly. That alone will have me going back when I need service again.

resp.text: Chris, we are glad that you had such a positive experience at our shop for your A/C leak. We do our best to be quick and thorough for our customers because you guys are our priority. Thank you for your review and we're happy that we have gained a new customer!

name: southvinemont
text: Everyone is so nice & helpful. They charge very reasonable rates and do quality work.  They inspected a Volvo i recently purchased and have given me nothing but top notch service and treatment.  Even giving me a ride home.. I definitely will be a returning customer and highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thanks for the recommendation! We appreciate and value all of our customers, when we receive feedback like this it fuels us to keep working hard every day! Thank you!

name: Matt Franks
text: I thoroughly enjoy doing business with the entire family. In fact, they feel like family and carry on conversations with me while I’m there. You definitely get a home town feel and the prices are reasonable

resp.text: We love having you around, Matt! Thank you!

name: Kim Elrod
text: Terry and his staff and very honesty, friendly, and courteous. I feel comfortable taking our vehicles to him and know that they will get the work done in a reasonable amount of time and for a reasonable price.

resp.text: Thank you for your 5-star review, Kim! We're happy to be honest, friendly, and courteous for your auto repair and maintenance needs. We look forward to having you back in our shop for a timely and reasonably-priced auto service!

name: Wesley Dawsey
text: Guthrie's is a great locally owned shop that has kept 4 older vehicles running for me over 7 years. They warranty their work and conduct business in a way to preserve their reputation. I'm sure there are other good shops in town, but I wouldn't go anywhere else.

resp.text: Thank you, Wesley! We are glad to have you as a customer!

name: Elizabeth Gervais
text: Great place. Every one is friendly and honest. They were very kind while we waited for our car to be serviced.

resp.text: Thank you Elizabeth for your review! We will continue to offer friendly and honest auto repair service, and we look forward to assisting you in the future!

name: Mike Howell
text: Quick and efficient work, extremely nice and polite people very helpful, I will carry all my vehicles there from now on!!

text: Terry and his crew were absolute life-savers.  We were traveling down through town when our alternator went out. Thanks Terry and crew!

Everything about this place is AWESOME.

Jared,

Customer service and honesty are what we take the most pride in here at Guthrie's Auto Service. Unfortunately, we are unable to find anybody in our system by the name of Jared Lumpkin. text: Bought a lifetime balance and rotation 56,000 miles ago.  Managed to get it done 3 times.  The last time I lost a center cap and all 4 tires had different air pressure.  Wal-Mart claimed they have proof from video cameras it was done properly.   Prior to this it had been about 12,000 miles since the last rotation.  I had made numerous attempts to have this done and was told it would be about a 4 hour wait.  Another attempt I was told it would be about 3 hours.  Again I was told they had now idea when they could get to it.   I asked to make an appointment but was told I couldn't.   I now have a set of Michelin tires with uneven wear.  A waste of $36, a waste of a new set of Michelin tires and the toll it takes on a person who has to try to communicate with people who have no communication skills and just don't care.   Do yourself a favor and go anywhere but here.

name: Covenant Wildlife
text: Decided to give this new location a shot with one of my companies trucks that needed tires. After they installed the tires I left and within 30 min the TPS light came on. The technician never calibrated the sensors. I called the store and told them what happened and the guy said to bring it back by and I told him that it would have to be tomorrow as I had a full route planned and did not expect it to take over 2 hours to just install 4 tires and that I was late for my customers. I asked if I could bring it by in the am and he said that was fine that the tech would calibrate the sensors and that it would only take a min to do. I show up this am  (after clearing some time on my calendar) and I tell the guy who I am and what I am there for and he informs me that they have no mechanic available to do this and that I would have a pretty long wait. I tell him that if the tech did his job correctly, I would not even have to be here a second time. He just says sorry. So I make an appointment for Tuesday to come back a tired time for something the tech should have done right in the beginning. I will take my fleet plus my personal cars elsewhere. Probably go right next door to Christian Brothers.

name: Craig Winn
text: Love the Firestone auto care locations. One of the service reps from the Pelham location is moving here. Great guy and lots of help. Looking forward to this addition in our neighborhood.

name: Richard Thompson
text:
Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.
I spent 10 minutes on the phone the day before letting the guy know that I was in search of a car mechanic I could trust to tell me what NEEDS to be fixed on my car, not what makes them the most money.  He assured me they would take care of me and he completely understood and that I could trust them.  The next day, after bringing my car in, it was clear they were trying to upsell with strong recommendations for everything from new tires (still have 5k-10k of tread) to all new brakes and rotors for the whole car to the $130 "fuel treatment system", to a NEW SUSPENSION FOR MY CAR.  Yes, they tried to recommend I buy a new suspension system.

I will never go there again and will go find a different mechanic I can trust.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: Fast and friendly service! I had something stuck in my tire and I only had to wait about 30 minutes for them to repair it and get it back on my van. I will definitely be back!

name: Richard Gayheart
text: My initial experience was pleasant and we discussed what was necessary to fix the truck. I needed to order a specialty part to finish the work. When I brought the part in, there was a different person running the front. At that point, things went downhill. Now I needed several new parts. The person was condescending and spoke to me like I didn’t have a clue. After I explained I had cleared the repairs with the first person and we had emailed the parts needed, this new person demanded to see the email. I retrieved the email and the reply was ‘wow, that was an expensive part’ and told me I needed more parts. I left the store because further conversation was not going to improve the situation. The next day I called the store and spoke with the original front person. My issues were resolved and the truck was fixed, but I will not return based on the second person I interacted with.

name: Tim Hedderly
text: Employees are friendly and personable.  I live in Helena, but will (am) traveling to the 280 location for this service.

name: Brent Curtin
text: I'm a little disappointed.  i went in to see if they could patch my tire.  its run flat so they said they couldn't.  said i need to buy a new tire.  that's ok.  was told that at other locations.  but then he told me that i need 2 new tires on the back as well.  my car is brand new and has 18,000 miles on it and i know tires can go bad at 18,000 miles, unlikely, but can happen.  that was a real turn off trying to sell something not needed.  when i used to go to another of their locations in mobile, the girls and guys down there had me running on slicks before they tried to sell me a tire.  they made sure i didnt buy tires until i really needed them and they had my loyalty.  trying to rip people off isnt a way to get return customers especially when they are putting competition right across the street from you.  just my opinion.

text: The gentleman that help me was very kind.  he checked the brakes on a car and saw that I did not need new brakes and he was not trying to sell me something I did not need. I Highly Recommend going here...

text: Although Midas is a national company this one has a mom and pop type vibe to it. they're extremely honest (which is surprising considering the business), and super professional. Today's visit had me going in and checking why my brakes are constantly squeeling. They took a look at it, and told me they were fine. They didn't try to replace something that wasn't broken, nor did they try to find something else wrong with my car. No charge and on my way within about 30 minutes. Highly recommend them!
