text: The brothers who own the Tuscaloosa Midas, as well as the other employees, were very genuine and helpful throughout the whole process. They took the time to explain the problems I was having with the rear shocks on my car, as well as showed me how worn the shocks were. I would recommend the honest service of this shop to anyone who is deciding where to get car work done.

text:
Pretty much got scolded going here. Due to an issue that really wasn’t taken seriously.
I won’t be going here again.

My family and my boyfriend even drove the car. They still notice the problem.

Took it Hyundai and they actually diagnosed the problem.

name: Alexis Brewe
text: Very dissatisfied with my experience here. I chose Midas based on the great reviews and went to the shop to get an oil change and maintenance check, because my car had been shaking the last few days. The maintenance tech did not properly check my tires, inform me of the extent of damage to my tires, or give me any answers about the shaking. I had a tire blow on the interstate four days later that caused an incredible amount of damage to my vehicle. First time in my life that I’ve gone to a car shop and they haven’t recommended that I buy new tires, and I seriously wish they had. I wouldn’t go here again.

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for the feedback. We are very sorry to hear that you didn't get excellent customer experience we expect to be provided to our customers. We'd really like to talk to you more in regards to your experience, but we need some additional information from you first. Please click goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

name: Stephen Moss
text:
These are phenomenal folks. Kind of a humble operation, but they are my new go to for used tires and basic service.

Today I had a fast leaking front tire and found them on a referral. I told Adriana the owner I'd preferred that if she could had two decent Continentals for the front to match the rears to just replace.

She had two at the Clanton and could have her husband bring up in about three hours. To help me, she literally installed a temporary tire so I could take care of my business.

Three hours later I returned. They changed the tire again to the newer Continentals, excellent condition btw and charged me for the original quoted price for the two Continentals.

Also their two dogs are friendly sweethearts.

The only thing better than the their product is their service.

Phenomenal!

text: Originally went here to get transmission work done on my dodge, and everything was smooth for about two months. Then, my battery light comes on and I get someone to look at it. Took it back here because it was under warranty, and Michael Benson was incredibly rude to me and my husband. He looked and acted as though we were a HUGE inconvenience. He even told my husband, "I don't know why she didn't just take it to the other location." (referring to me. ) Would not recommend. That employee just completely ruined my experience with this company.

text: Amazing!!! Danelle was so kind and helpful. From out of town and needed assistance with my tire and they went over and above of what I expected! Recommend to anyone who is looking for friendly hometown service.

name: Jake Jones
text: Great place. I'm usually out in 30-45 minutes when getting oil changed. The key to not waiting hours is to not go when everyone else does (as is with any other service). They offer shuttle service to the surrounding areas. They seem to retain their employees which means you are getting experienced techs each time. Recently when getting my oil changed, the tech found $10 in my seat. They made a point to bring it to me. To me this showed that I can trust them (in all honesty I didn't even know it was there!) I've also gotten tires here and they gave me a great price and did a great job.

name: ashli Jennings
text: Always a great experience.  Great customer service!

name: Bill Wolfe
text:
First visit I woke up to oil all over my garage floor the next morning.  Care was not taken to capture the oil when they changed it and left my skid plate full of oil which resulted in the mess.  Not to mention the oil that blew all over my exhaust and the smell I had to tolerate.  Complained to manager and received a sincere apology.  He asked that I give them a chance to do it right.

Second chance...  Leaving on a trip Saturday.  I called Thursday to inquire about an appointment.  I was told they do not accept appointments but they will be happy to work me in Friday.  I took 2 hours of vacation in order to allow ample time for my oil change and tire rotation (arrived at 1:00 PM).    When I arrived I was told they were not accepting any more oil changes for the day.  I explained I had called the previous day and was told that I would be  accommodated.  The reply from the counter was "Don't know what to tell ya..." while bouncing a pen on the counter and sucking air through his teeth.

There won't be a third chance.

text: Great service. Great people!

text:
Unprofessional and Poorly Managed, Don't Go Here.

I went to Midas in Meridianville for specific (rear diff) and general (oil change etc) services, I choose to do business here after a midweek visit asking if they could provide everything I am looking for. The Manager indicated they provided those services and I made a 7:30 am appointment for a few days later. Appointment day I arrive at the appointed time to locked doors and wait 15 minutes for someone to show up, while I was waiting I noticed trash from the previous days services and appointments all in the service bays. With the late open and the trashy appearance I should have left as these are signs of poor management. They took custody of my vehicle for the remainder of the day, of which I had to call them at closing time to see if there was an update, they were unaware of the status and had to call me back. When I heard back from them they said it was done and we agreed I would pick up the following morning, when I arrived they indicated half of the things I asked to be done weren't done and they can not do them (rear dif & and tire service). I was not charged for the items but now I need to make another service appointment elsewhere.

Separately, one of the Technicians blocked my wife and kids in while they were dropping me off. I went out to ask him to move of which he replied "she can get by", I followed up and asked him to please move, she is driving a larger unfamiliar vehicle (my truck) and would appreciate some extra space. He slurred at me under his breath and attempted to coal roll me in the parking lot.

resp.text: Hi Randy, we are sorry that you did not have a positive experience at our location. If you'd like to tell us more, please visit https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

text:
So far,, (because I have to take it back
This AM after having entire brake system replaced by them over 2+ days) I now dont have a parking brake, when I did when I took it in. With All new system its harder to apply "what brakes I do have them my peterbilt with a 53 foot and 80k lbs load on board. So far I'm $3000 in the hole and my truck runs worse Note that it was good, I just wanted to have it restored. So much for restoration. All new system ! SO FAR, VERY VERY DIS SATISFIED.   CHECK BACK WITH ME, IF THIS THING DONT GET ME OR MY FAMILY KILLED TAKING IT BACK. Either way, check back with me, because if it isn't fixed properly and something happens you will hear from me or my sons or lawyer. Cant believe this kind of stuff from Midas. But I do now!!!!!!!

text:
Called up there to schedule a drop off. Because they had good reviews. Not the friendliest person who answered the phone. That's fine but when I told him what was going on he said we dont do transmission work. My problem is it says they do on their website. Rude and waste of time. Going to add to the post I was discriminated against I guess because I'm a woman. my husband called the place and said exactly what I said the problem
Was and they told him yes they do that there.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Oliver. We do not rebuild transmissions, but we do remove and replace transmissions with either used transmissions or remanufactured transmissions. A gentleman called yesterday and obtained a price to replace the torque convertor. I am not sure if this was your husband or not, but we can replace a torque convertor because it is physically attached to the transmission and is not an internal part. I believe there may have been some miscommunication as to what was required to repair the vehicle/transmission. Alabaster Automotive, LLC prides itself in servicing EVERYONE in the community and we do not discriminate against anyone based on sex, ethnicity, religion, etc. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to me with a phone call. Thank you.

text: New Ownership and New Management.  All new people. They have done a great job for us, very sincere and trustworthy to give them a chance!  Try them out.

name: Kayla Johnson
text: John is great! My dad recommended these folks yo me and they are great! I won't be going to anyone else when I need work done. They're honest and do great work.

name: Kenneth Sanchez
text: Charges out the a** for a diagnostic and didn’t even find what was wrong with my vehicle. Imagine.

resp.text: Mr. Sanchez, sorry to hear that you are not happy. Checking our records, we found the issue that you were having with your car after the diagnostic we performed.  I personally showed you that your wiring harness had been severed by the oversize wheels that where put on your car. Please feel free to reach out with any questions you may have. Thank you.

name: CallMehMaddy
text: I will never take my truck anywhere else from now on!  I took my truck to them a couple of weeks ago and they were honest/fair priced and fixed it within a few hours!  Wayne and John were amazing, as were the rest of the techs.  They were a blessing in my life that I so much needed and they made me laugh!  I am recommending them to all of my friends no matter where they live in Alabama. Thank you for the little blessings Alabaster Auto!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing about your experience, Lisa! We're glad you like our awesome staff as much as we do, and that you were happy with our pricing and speed! We really appreciate the recommendation and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Nancy McCay
text:
Fantastic service !
Honest and fast.

name: Andrae Antwoine
text: They explain, very professional, but not accountable for any mistakes.  I have 4 kids and wife, the expense was necessary..they had to replace spark plugs, explained that if removed, Its a possibility some will break off...well 1 got stuck in the engine.....it requires taking everything out and restructure how it was before...with no mistakes...so it took 2-3 weeks to get it done...after 3100$ mechanic informed us #1 he drove the car 65 miles testing the truck..no gas reimbursement (not considering our financial needs)....#2.that our sensor light was not working, (but we never had an issue with it),they didn't charge us for replacing it, but now it  ironically reads an alternator light.  #3 The mechanic simply said, i don't know why it came on, but it needs to be replaced. Although, your safe to drive it home.   #4. 2 weeks later, a great amount of smoke begins to shoot out exhaust...that very day, I took it to another auto place to get it assessed. (my red flags were to much).The other repair shop did not go into detail, but towed it back to alabaster, free of charge told them the issue and Alabaster Auto's  said "we'll give them a call".  #5 2 days later, I called them...ask "what is the problem?" they replied: The fluid injectors ironically messed up within 2 weeks, causing oil to spill onto the motor, "washing it out"...not only did they tell me an alternator was needed, but now I have to buy a new motor. Their excuse was....this is all a coincidences. they don't know why these thing are happening to my ford expedition that is under 120,000 miles. I called the other auto store to come and get it...I'll pay them what is necessary, but I am not spending another dime at alabaster Auto's.  We are taking legal action against them immediately after proof of fault. I can't except "it's all a coincidence".

resp.text: Andrae, one of our goals is to be honest and forthright with our customers. Also, we make every effort to ensure our customers are satisfied.  We deeply regret not being able to do so in your situation.

name: Tim Brewer (jugglertim)
text: Older shop, but they have always been good to me. Very reasonable prices and honest people.

name: Mighty Mouse
text: I really like Alabaster Auto. They always do good work and have great prices! Mr. Ricky is a very friendly guy. I think they really care about their customers and have been in Alabaster since I moved here when I was about 8 yrs old, 30+ years later and they are still packed with business every day. That should speak volumes in of itself.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write this nice review! We're glad you like our work, prices, and that you can see how much Ricky and the team care about our customers like you. Thanks again and see you next time!

name: Ramarao CS
text: Ricky and Wayne have been there for God knows how long!! Excellent and reasonable service. Like it that they take NO reservations. Strictly first come first served!! Ricky once apologized to me that a replacement tire to my Lexus was expensive!!!! Go figure.

resp.text: We're so glad you like Ricky and Wayne's service and our reservation-free business model! We're glad we have been able to take care of you and your vehicles over the years and thank you for writing this review!

name: Heather Edmondson
text: Great place!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to recognize our helpful staff, Jimmy! We appreciate it!

name: Katrina Hinkle
text: Amazing guys! They always have gone above and beyond to help with all of my car needs. They do not nickel and dime you to death. They will forever have my business and I recommend them to any and everyone who needs service.

text: The entire team was willing to help me loosen up my lug nuts.  They did it put of their personal time and didn't even charge me. They are an Awesome Team!

name: Ben Hutsler
text: Been using these guys for the 2 years I lived in Alabaster.  Mechanics John and Randall are great, they will talk to you, make suggestions and both tell and show you what they are doing.  Only issue was when I took my vehicle to them right before Christmas and it was 3 days to even look at the car.  I didn't have the time so I took it to another Alabaster repair shop..................................MAJOR MISTAKE!!!  Keep up the great work Wayne and Ricky and all involved at Alabaster Auto! Thanks. Ben

resp.text: You're welcome, Ben. Thank you for your review and continued business with us!

name: Dayon Lane
text:
Do NOT aide this place. My CRV had to go in to have the fan assembly replaced. Upon getting it back I saw that my A/C no longer blew cold and my automatic window function no longer worked. Then, when taking it in to be looked at, I found that they BROKE what holds to coolant reservoir and just had it sitting, and it was empty. They had lost two of the caps on the front, AND they didn’t attach the grill back correctly.

I called them and they said to bring it in Saturday. I head that way and call them to tell them I’m on the way. And they inform me not to come Bc they are not able to do it Saturday and to come Monday. Isn’t an option for me. I paid $532 for them to essentially break my car. WILL never go back.

name: Andrew Hicks
text: GREAT staff! Very friendly and professional. The level of service on my car was too notch. We won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank you for all of the great feedback, Andrew!

name: Mark Wright
text: Had alternator and pulley replaced in June this year here.  Recently car wasnt  starting had to jump off took car to 2 places to check battery and alternator checked (free)was told it was alternator so took in here and they checked said it was the battery which I have no problem with but when I got there it was 42 dollar. Guess I should have asked first just assumed the shop that did the work would have done it free too.  Lesson learned I guess.

name: CEE WEST
text:
We recently had one of our cars worked on here and the service was fantastic.  My son and his family have their cars worked on here as well.
If you need a good honest repair service this is the place.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback on your experience. Happy we could help!

text: Can't even change brakes and rotors correctly. I brought it in several times after they changed them with a noise and they couldn't find it and blamed it on something else. Finally got tired of it and took it to another mechanic and they left bolts out of my caliper and I've had 2 brakes lock up since they did the work.

They were Saturday but got us in quickly within a few mins. The mechanic and the older gentleman in the office were very friendly and courteous. The gentleman sent us on our way to enjoy our vacation and didn't charge us. If you're having car trouble in this area this is your place. They are Great folks!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! Our main concern has always been the safety and satisfaction of our customers. We’re glad to hear we have delivered that. Thanks again, Justin!

text: The store manager Ricky Tidmore lied to my family and took over $12,000 dollars all the while blaming me on how the car was driven. Sold us a transmission when the motor and transmission needed to be replaced. DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

text: My last review wasn't what I intended. I just figured how to change it. They really do have a five star rating with me.

resp.text: If there is anything we can do to earn the 5th star warren please let us know.

name: kevin armstrong
text: I came here to have a plug put in my trailer tire. I waited and was told to back my truck around. When i started backing in someone else whips in and i was forced to stop. He comes up to my window and tells me to wait just a minute and let him take care of this customer. I waited another 10-15 minutes. He finally plugs my tire, i pay and leave. I drive 1/2 Mile home. Get up the next morning and the tire is low again. I drive back down there and tell them something was wrong. There was one person in the lobby and he tells me the wait would be at least one hour to put air in my tire. I had to unload several things from my trailer to get to tools needed for me to put air in it myself. I did this in there parking lot as they say inside and watched me. They won't make there wrongs right. Expert tire is right across the street.

resp.text: Kevin, when we reached out it sounded like you had no issues with your experiences at our shop after we offered to assist in any way we could. If there are any further concerns, please reach out to us as we would like to clear up any misunderstandings. Thank you.

name: Chase Miller
text:
First time customer, came in off recommendation from a friend.

Staff friendly, clean waiting room, good location, fair advertised prices.

3 stars due to being told over phone an oil change would be 20-30 mins wait, showed up 20 mins after the call and I sat in the waiting area over 1-1/2 hrs (I waited because I understand business, and things do happen) without anyone informing me of any delays. I left without recieving any service.

Don't set expectations and then not fulfill them without an explanation, before money walks out the door.

resp.text: Chase, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and for the feedback on your visit. We apologize if any part of your experience was less than satisfactory and we hope to have the opportunity in the future to work with you. If there is anything else that we are able to help with please feel free to give us a call.

text: We've used this place a handful of times and it seems reasonably priced and they get the work done in a timely manner. name: Ben Turner
text:
Been using these guys for about a year since moving to Alabaster. Their hourly rate is the cheapest I have found anywhere and they always take care of my problems on both my cars. Oil changes are only about $22 and that includes a tire rotation and they don't try to upsell you on a bunch of crap you don't need like alot of other places in the area who offer cheap oil changes and then make it up with additional "needs fixing items".

The mechanics and the 2 gentlemen at the front desk are always helpful, and courteous even though they are always busy and I can't thank them enough.

I don't believe for a second these 2 reviews that say they did such a poor job and accept that some people are never happy unless they can drag everyone else into the misery pit where they reside.

Thanks Alabaster Auto and I will continue to use you and recommend you to my friends as long as I am in this area.

Ben

The most recent vist to purchase tires for my car was not so good. It was shocking enough that the owner helping me abruptly left for a lunch engagement in the middle of the sale promising to call me after lunch. Even more so when I never received the call back to order the tires. Needless to say I took my business elsewhere and won't be returning.

resp.text: As i replied to your complaint months ago, you are posting your complaint on the site for Hampton Cove Auto Service. My name is Michael Cox & i have owned & operated Hampton Cove Auto Service since 1998. And as for you Mr. Hicks you have never been an employee of Hampton Cove Auto Service.

text:
December 2017: Amazing customer service! Highly recommend
January 2019: Mike and Jaquata were again fantastic. Not only through their customer service but demonstrated through their technical skills.  I never feel like just "another customer". This family run business is best in town. Excellent service, again highly recommended. I would rate Hampton Cove Auto Service 10 out of 5 Stars if I could.

name: Toby Keef
text: I can not be seen to even get service. I have been by three times to get my vehicle serviced to get told to call on this day or that day. I understand that you are busy but how's about offering a time slot or an appointment.  Often people have to change there life and there families life around to free up a vehicle. Just doesn't seem professional or considerate as a business looking to supply there community and there clients with service.

resp.text: Once again mistaken Hampton Cove Auto for Cove Auto. We set appointments for our customers.

name: Shaun Osborne
text: New management. Used prior to change, always fair. Went by because air quit blowing cold. Asked how much to hook up gauges to test pressure and was told "shouldn't be any charge". The compressor was engaging and disengaging so i figured it might be plugged. The technician hooked it up and saw the high side was too high and low side very low. It was plugged. They tried to say they had to pull codes and all this junk and i told them it runs fine except for the a/c. I shut off the a/c and it ran fine, it would bog down when the compressor engaged. They tried to make more out of it, then charged me $45. Avoid if possible.

resp.text: Not us!! WE have been here since 1998, no new management.

name: Kirk Ward
text: Great Service and always a fair price.

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us.

name: Andrew Raymond Crawford
text: I am looking to purchase a 2002-2006 Cadillac Escalade and I used Hampton Cove Auto Services for the pre-purchase inspection of an example I was considering.  The car seemed ok to me, although I knew there were some issues with the shock absorbers and brakes.  The PPI was the best $55 I ever spent and saved me from getting mired in a long list of reliability problems and expensive repairs that would have equaled the purchase price of the car!  I haven't found the right car yet, but will try to bring a few more examples to Hampton Cove Auto Services until we identify the right one.  As well as having a diligent technical team, I have found Jaquata on the customer service side to be both accommodating and very personable.  My neighbor says she has been happily using Hampton Cove Auto Services for many years and it's very easy to see why.  I will use them again as my first preference auto mechanic.

text:
My son's truck wouldn't start one morning. The towing company took it to the nearest auto repair shop, Goodyear. They told him it needed a new fuel pump and would cost $795! I didn't feel right about it so I called another repair shop for a second quote. The second quote was $200 less but that's not the kicker! I had the truck towed to the other repair shop. They called me shortly after the vehicle arrived and said it was ready to go. NOTHING wrong with the fuel pump. The intake valve was clogged!

I can't decide if the staff just isn't knowledgeable or if they make their best money by taking advantage of people.

text: This place seems nice and is always busy but if you’re a female definitely take a male with you. They may try to take advantage of you. Bought two tires from them, both went bad! Both went bad within the 7 day warranty they had an excuse for both of them as to way they couldn’t replace my tire or give me my money back. Which of course those reason weren’t explained when I bought the tire I was just told “anything wrong bring it back” but when I did that it was reason they couldn’t accept. I just hate when I feel places aren’t honest UPFRONT! Seems nice, was even super nice when explaining why I couldn’t get my refund or another tire.. but being nice doesn’t disguise th trickery. I wouldn’t have any issue if they had never said “full 7 day warranty, anything wrong bring it back” if that wasn’t the case! Let me know all the “buts” before I buy, not afterwards  when I return it!! And they keep the tire you’re replacing.. who knows why 🤔. Ask as many questions and search the tire like crazy before you drive off other wise you may be screwed. Good luck to them tho and good luck to you if you try them out.

name: C.L. Harris
text: Got home and discovered I had a slash in my tire. Yet somehow the tire hadnt lost any air. It was late in the evening and all the tire shops I called were closed or about to close. All the shops I called the earliest they could get a 22 inch tire was the next day they had to order them from their warehouse. Only places that would have their tire inventory on hand would be used tire shops. Most of the ones I called didnt answer the phone. Found a tire shop on other side of town that had one in stock. I need that tire desperately so I took a chance and slowly rode on the other side of town on a slashed tire only to get over there and be told that the tire wasnt any good. By then all the tire shops was closed all except Express Tire that is. As Im heading back home I see that Express Tire Open sign On, they close 1 hour later than the rest of the tire shops in town. I walk up there and find out that they have several 22 inch tires! They saved the day. Pass by that place every single day and never once did I bothered to stop there for any tire services. Pass by them to go to other places, but never again! Theyve gained a loyal customer now

text: Literally probably the worst service I've ever gotten in my life, not just with a tire spot. I bought my 2011 Chevy Malibu here to get my headlight replaced. If you are familiar with cars, you would know its not easy to do this, for the front bumper almost needs to come off. Before being serviced here, I talked to 3 men who told me they would be able to fix my headlight and to go get the bulb so it could be serviced. After buying this bulb, i came back to this business and parked in their garage. One of the men started working on it immediately. I was satisfied until i noticed he kept walking away and coming back, so i sat in my car. After this, I notice all the employees are gone. My car still not fixed, its passing an hour now. I go looking for everyone and the employees are sitting there eating and watching TV. I say "Um, are you going to finish what you were doing?" He doesn't answer, someone speaks up for him saying "Well he's on lunch break" , I go back to my car .Another 20 minutes pass and im still sitting in my car. Guy comes back and says "I cant do it"... These people 1. Assured me they could replace my headlight before he even started taking my car apart, 2. Disappear and go on a "lunch break" with my bumper half off and never notify me, and 3. Had me sitting there for OVER an hour and I end up leaving discouraged. Please find out who owns this business. I will never go here again and I advise anyone else not to except for tire repair.

Update- 8/10/19
Went there early because I had a leak in my tire. I was turned away, because of "over-bookage". There was nobody sitting in the lobby either. I previously spent $500.00 for new tires and alignment, and I posted a good review on that. So, I went back again. I drove 20 minutes to get there, because I do not live close to their shop. I get, " Sorry... we cannot help you today". They cannot do a simple tire patch on one of the tires that I brought from them? I would have waited on that to be done too. This is poor, and unacceptable customer service. I got it patched at another tire shop, Jim Whaley tires. That tire shop was extremely busy, but they still waited on me. name: Mark Richards
text:
On Tuesday Nov. 29 2016 I was traveling west on HWY 84 in Alabama and my Tahoe began to have an extreme vibration. The vibration was not in the steering wheel but the chassis. It felt like a u-joint to me so I proceeded slowly at 25mph to try and locate help. I pulled into the A-1 Tire Sale & Service Goodyear dealer and asked if they could repair my vehicle and what I thought it was. They said they would look at it and see if the could. After some time the mechanic returned to get the Service Writer and they exited and soon she returned to let me know that what was wrong was both front wheel bearings were bad  and my idler arm and bracket were worn out. I asked how much to fix ans was quoted $446.00. I asked was u-joint bad ?"no it OK " I was told. I asked to see my vehicle and when I spun the wheels I herd no noise, when I checked for play by lifting up on tire I noticed none. Then moving tire side to side I felt no play in the Idler arm. Now mind you anything can break at ant time, but I had my vehicle in the shop last week for a tie rod end and front end alignment by men I have trusted for years. So I refused the repairs and for my vehicle to be taken off the lift. The mechanic then came over to where we were, I then asked him "you didn't find anything wrong with the u-joint? NO was his answer. As he backed the vehicle off the lift a loud ping could be heard, like that you here when you have a bad u-joint. I then drove to another shop recommended by my son-in-law, and when their mechanic walked under the vehicle he could see the u-joint was bad with out touching it.
U-joint was repaired and $70.00 later I was on the road with no vibration.    So before I let A-1 Tire do any work on my vehicle I would recommend you take it to a honest shop to determine what is really wrong.

name: Jamie Nedderman
text: Well I'm not from this town but I was driving through with my five-month-old and my hungry, autistic five-year-old.  I must've ran over something because my inflation light came on and when I pulled off, it was nearly flat.  At almost 5pm on a Friday.  These guys are very near the highway so I kinda limped the van along to their shop after finding it on Google.  Knowing nothing of this town, I won't lie, appearances made me a bit nervous.  There were no strobe lights, electronic signs, or LED TV's.  No tires set up to convince you that you needed that model.  But this place was a gem, and I'm so fortunate and lucky that I stumbled on it.  They didn't have a tire for my van, so the owner himself drove across town to get one, in what I know was work hour traffic (because I was soon back in it).  You know these guys wanted to go home for the day, but they balanced my tire and pulled it together after their posted hours.  He could've charged ten times what he did, for after hours, or having to pick up a tire, or for my clear lack of knowledge and naïveté, but he gave me a total price MUCH cheaper than the price I bought those tires for during a scheduled appointment at another place.  Made it safely home with little wait time, with my two littles.  While I was there I saw a couple guys stop in that clearly knew the owner/place, and I realized..... this type of place is the one, if you find it, you go there the rest of your life.  It's a bummer when your car breaks down and usually a surprise expense, but these guys aren't going to rip you off - they'll do the right thing.  I don't live in this town, don't know anybody there to refer personally, and unless that happens again, I'll probably never go there again, but he still did the right thing.  This place is the real deal.

resp.text:
Sorry to have disappointed you. We do try our best to do everything we can to make our customers happy. We also go by book time per Mitchell labor times. If labor calls for 2hrs and we do it in 3hrs you still only get charged for 2hrs. Also if parts are on the other side of town we do have to wait on them to get here. That can take some time as well. I’m sorry if wait times got longer than usual. We definitely do not charge extra if it’s taking more time to get your vehicle finished per what estimate says. I hope you can understand and thank you for allowing us to service and repair your vehicles.
MGMT
Bo Bradley

text:
Owner Mike Woodham puts building relationships with his customers first over making a quick buck. I needed to replace a part on the body of my car. Mike could have ordered the part and installed it right then. However, he gave me several options which saved me a lot of money. I trust him. He made a customer for life.

I also love that full service includes a bottle of cold water while the staff checks fluid levels and tire pressure.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Martha , we at Woodhams pursue every avenue to save our customers as much money as possible. Thank you for allowing us to serve you .

name: Anita Watson
text: Mr. Woodham helped our daughter out when we could not get her! He was friendly, and his prices were nice! It’s nice to know that while our daughter is in Auburn, she has an honest place of business to see about her car! I highly recommend him for all your college student’s car needs!!

resp.text:
Thank you Mrs Watson . We at Woodhams will make sure the real issue will be handled . We will not fail you or your family .

Mike Woodham

name: gina forbes
text: Unfortunately the "check engine" light came on in my daughters vehicle...she is a student at Auburn so we had to have it addressed there and not at "home" ... When I called the shop ( which was recommended by a sorority sister of hers) Mr. Woodham personally answered the phone... he was kind, knowledgable, and took a brief description of what the issue was... when my daughter arrived at his shop...he personally greeted her, offered her coffee, and even a ride back to campus if she needed one...during the course of the day he spoke to both myself and my husband ...was able to take care of the two issues... and assured us that her vehicle was once again safe to drive.  I would highly recommend Woodhams Full Service... and plan on stopping in the next time I am in Auburn to introduce myself and thank him personally!

resp.text:
Mrs Forbes . Your daughter is a very classy little girl . I’m sure you guys are extremely proud of her . Thank you for allowing us to serve you .

Mike Woodham

name: Reggie Whiddon
text: Great people great service I make a point to have my tank on empty every time I pass through here, what a great experience just like the old days, and if you need mechanical work on your car they have the best mechanic and bonus he looks like cooter from the dukes of hazzard. Do yourself and your car a favor and stop here

resp.text:
Mr Reggie !!! Thank you for the great 5 years , allowing us to serve you .

Mike Woodham

name: King Bee
text: Nice folks! Friendly service!

resp.text:
Thank you King Bee !!!
Mike Woodham

name: Kaleb Smith
text: Woodhams has replaced both the heater core in my '04 Colorado and the timing belt in my '99 Civic. Many shops in this area seem eager to take advantage of people so it was refreshing to come across a place that charges fair prices and provides quality service!

resp.text:
Thank you Kaleb . We at Woodhams know how hard it is to cover repair costs . We aim high at saving y’all the most money we can , provided by an ASE certified technician.
Mike Woodham

name: Kambria Tolbert
text: It takes a disgusting person and business of no integrity to use the cover of night to dump tires down a ditch. I caught them red handed tonight in a neighborhood made up of senior citizens and veterns. I will not stop until they are held accountable.

resp.text:
Miss Tolbert , I thought I was helping a vet out . I paid him to haul tires off in my truck . Had I known he was dumping tires in your neighborhood, I would have never deliberately endangered the environment. I personally removed the 16 tires of mine , he dumped . I also removed the other 175 he dumped that were not mine . This issue has been handled .
Mike Woodham

resp.text: Mr Golden one of our first and very loyal customers, . You rock - thank you for supporting my lil gas station . WDE

I had to come home and put lawn mower back together. Don't recommend them at all from my experience.

Two things needed to be bolted back on. Then when I called to complain about them. The front desk girl got mad and said there is nothing I can do and she hung up on me. I was set to buy a lawn mower from them so glad they showed their true colors before I did.

text: One star means negative one (-1). Stagnant Waters sold me a NEW Toro mower with a torn seat last year. I showed them the tear when they delivered it. They said they would replace it with a new one but they never did! The owner won't even return my calls! If you're looking for a place that won't service what they sell and will lie to you, Stagnant Waters is the PLACE!

name: Michael Coley
text: I bought a utility trailer from them. The trailer I bought was their top of the line fully tubed model. The trailer itself is great and is really sturdy. The problem that I have is with the paint job. They don’t use primer and I doubt they do any prep before they spray it. I have a 3 month old trailer with rust all over it. So now I will have to sand and paint all the rust as long as I own it. It just sucks having to do that when you pay $1300 for a 12 foot trailer and get this result.

resp.text: Mr. Coley, Muddy Waters is a dealer of Native Trailers LLC, we have sent your info over to the manufacture they are the ones that would supply the warranty on the trailer. We are sorry for the inconvenience . If you do not hear from them please give us a call.

name: Timothy sides
text: It is a good place to buy used autos and mowers, and small tractors and trailers. The people are very nice.

name: Levi Ogle
text: Buying a trailer from this company was easy. Getting what you paid for what like pulling teeth. The advertisement of gate folds flat is not true, it does not. The welding job is absolutely terrible. The available options they have should not be offered cause they do a half job adding them. The "conduit" used is just PVC. My wiring connect looked like it came off a 10 year old trailer. When i went to pick it up, the gate latches only engaged on one side. Had to leave it there to be fixed.

name: Roger Hill
text: Good people

name: Raymond Key
text: I recently purchased a building from Muddy Waters at $213 down on the day of purchase I asked the sales representative to send out someone to see if they could bring the building up my drive and set the building up the sales rep Said no that they had a machine they could put the building anywhere on day of delivery they could not deliver and set up building , when I asked for a refund they said no and referred me to the manufacturer in return they manufacture said no to a refund and also told me you had to have a 14 foot wide path and fairly level ground to set the building up which is something Muddy Waters didn't tell me, and it will also cost for  another delivery I get a monthly government disability check and don't have money to burn an lose and screwed out of 213 dollars

text: Took my older bass boat up there for a tune up , ran rough before I took it but did run .over 300 bucks later with new battery and plugs it won't start at all . Battery that was installed is way to small for one and on top of that now I have a boat I sunk $300+ in won't start at all and the battery is junk. NEVER AGAIN. THATS JUST THE MARINE SERVICE SIDE ! Everyone was really good on pleasing me up till I got home and tryed cranking the boat and it turns over maybe 8 times and dies so I just called it a loss I guess😒guess most of the positive reviews are family and friends. Talk to real customers if you know any. They will let you know to do business elsewhere. CROOKS BY THE BOOKS

name: Kristin Watson
text: My husband and I bought not just one but two little four wheelers for our kids,   I had been shopping g around d we got a fair price for them.  The reason for my one star, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!  My kids wore down the brakes, I don't think they were hard on them, or our brake light is working.  We called while they were under warranty.  It took two weeks to get back about parts.  At that point the parts were out of warranty.  So we paid for them and shipping.  We got the wrong parts.  I even took picture the second time.  We got parts that look similar but size was wrong, would not work.  So Mailed them back along w one of the brake pads off the 4 wheeler and tracked them..  I found out that the package was delivered Thursday 4/28 .  I called and was told spouse was sick bit she sent picture to manufacture.  No call that we got them, they are working on it,, nothing.  This has been the way we have been treated.  You have to chase them down to get answers.  I asked to be called by the end of the week, with answers and a solution!  I haven't been able to ride our 4 wheelers since early March!  It's May 2nd!  It's not like we got these for free and didn't pay for replacement parts or shipping!

He said never in his 15 years has he ever broke a valve steam while rotating and balancing a tire. The employee there then tried to tell my husband he was going to have to go get a new one. I mean have some accountability. It’s not like we are asking a lot. Just do the job properly. Are these employees properly trained??

text: If I could give a negative stars for this place they would have a negative 10. This ace has no customer service. I will pay for my tires but I will never recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you Shatel for the feedback! We will continue to strive for 5 star excellence!

text:
Wish I can give a negative star.

Long story short -
Aside from horrible customer interaction, was quoted a Kumho tire for $199.99. Went to Pepboys and NTB, both offered under $130 for the same tire.

Unsure if that employee was trying to just scam and take advantage or this company is just overpriced. It was my first time and would be last.

Glad I researched beforehand. Just be careful and study the materials of service you need done before getting here.

name: Daniel Sigala
text:
The Manager Chris here is way out of his element. I had my truck towed here for work to be done. Prior to having truck brought there I called and spoke to him to be sure that what I need done would be completed by them.

Without even un-mounting the tire to see the puncture they determined it unfixable and I also couldn’t buy a replacement tire I was required to buy 2 tires.

After trying to sell me some tires that were currently mounted on an employees truck. It turns out they didn’t even have the tires in stock that he said they did.

The technician was a down to earth guy and straight forward but honestly held back by company management. This guy Chris is a money shark and doesn’t show the slightest interest in actually helping anyone. More like a money chasing tyrant with a small man complex.

resp.text: Hey Daniel Sigala so sorry to hear your experience wasn't awesome. What can I do to make it right?

name: Luis Varricchio
text: I had been watching the progress of the building (as it was being built). Well I finally stopped in while I was in town. They great you as you come through the door. Everyone there was very friendly and the service is outstanding. If you’re like me on a very tight budget they have multiple was to pay. Their prices are very competitive and some styles are even priced a bit lower. Next time I need another set of tires I won’t even shop around, I’ll be going straight there.

name: Antonio Richardson
text: Outstanding customer service. Me and my friend went up there on July 24, 2019 to go see why my tire was losing air. They greeted us when we walk in and gave us outstanding hospitality and free tire repair. I recommend this place to anyone trying to save a buck.

name: Jessica Brown
text: Went in for a slow leak in a rear tire.  Even though I didn't have an apt, they got me right in, found a 3" nail in my tire and had everything ready to go in less than an hour.  The staff was incredibly friendly and didn't give me the typical "female" treatment that I have received at other shops in the Auburn/Opelika area.  I will definitely return here for service and recommend them to anyone.

text: I purchased 4 new tires in March 2020. After driving my car for 2 days the tires were riding really bad. I checked my tire pressure and 4 tires were set at different numbers. When it was time to take my car back to be fixed they were shut down due to Covid. I still haven't been able to take my car because they're still closed. A total waste of my time & money. I will never do business with them again.

text: We were camping in Gadsden and got a nail in one of our truck tires. We arrived at 7:45 AM, with nobody in line ahead of us. It took them an hour and 15 minutes just to do a tire repair. The gentleman who checked us out told me that they "probably shouldn't have assigned us the slowest guy here to do your repair". It's 9:03 and we are finally pulling out of the driveway. They were nice but it's crazy that a 15 minute job took this long.
