name: james Czerniak
text: They wont see another dime from my pocket. My son had $600 worth of work done on his truck and about a week later, there was a noise coming from the same area the work was done. I had him call Gradys and ask if they can look and see if the part they put on was bad or if it was something else. My son was told to bring it in and a mechanic would take a look and see what was what. The mechanic(some old guy) took my son back and started blaming my son for the original problem we brought it in for. He was real rude. Then my son was told to go to the front office and they will put a quote together for him. The quote was for $3000 which he didn't have at the time so we waited until he could get the money together. Well, we decided to drop it off at another shop and see what they said before we paid the $3K. The other shop did the same work for $600. I would stay away! This isnt the first time I felt suspect about some work they have done.

resp.text: James, we are sorry to see this review and apologize for any inconvenience. When we did a little digging, the estimate that we had pulled was for $1,300, but we would love to discuss this with you furthur so we can work it out. Please give us a call at 334-745-3568. Thank you.

name: Regina Hutchins
text:
I have used Jernigan Nordmeyer for my tires and mechanical needs for 20 years...I can’t see myself using anyone else.  Fred is honest and you can always depend on him for getting your car turned around fast!  Pricing has always been fair to good!  With that being said...my most recent experience was a little discouraging.  I had a tire on the front of my car that was injured; their assessment overlooked the other bad tire that needed replacing as well.  Nevertheless...I had four new tires put on my car and an alignment. Good pricing and fast service!
I got home and opened my truck to find my spare and all the tire tools thrown everywhere and my trunk insert was almost ruined as it was bent with these heavy objects thrown on top of it. 🤦‍♀️
They do great work...fast friendly service...great pricing...but maybe needs to slow down a little and be more attentive with each customer from the time they  walk in the door to the time they walk out.
I still highly recommend them and have an appointment today servicing my daughters car!
Thank you Fred for always taking care of me!!!

resp.text: Thanks Regina for the nice review, but I am sorry to hear about the spare tire and the tools that is not like us at all and I would like to apologise, that should never happen. I think you may be right, we have been very busy since we moved, I think slowing down a little might be best us. Thank you for your business and I promise we will try harder to make sure everything is done better from here on.

name: Ernest Mallett
text:
Stopped in here last month to get 4 new tires.  Usually I go to one of the big name stores but they had what I needed in the price range.  About $640 for 4 new tires and getting them mounted and balanced.

Overall everyone seemed nice enough, but it took a little over 4 hours to get those put on.  What I was assuming would be a 1-2hr job took half of my day.  Several vehicles came in and left while I was waiting, the individual mounting the tires even kept getting pulled away to put air in other people's tires.

Don't get me wrong if you're just buying tires they can get them for a decent price.  But if you need them put on, I would go somewhere else.

resp.text: Ernest sorry to hear that you had a bad experience shopping with us. We are the only tire store that I know of that still offers free air to anyone who asks for it,  I have talked to the staff in the past about not stopping to check air pressure but sometimes it still happens. But again I am sorry that you had a bad experience having your tires mounted, please remember we offer free rotation and balance for the life of your tires. I hope you will try us again, I'm sure we will meet or exceed your ecpectations,.

name: Christina Rhodes
text:
Brought my car in for repairs. Let me start off by saying im unsure of my internal repairs. Diagnosis was great. He knew what it was... but when i got my car back and took it on a trip to florida I almost didnt make it back. 3 out of 8 of my coil packs where so lose they could have came off. They also did work on my chain guides and tensioners. 2300$ worth of work. The car jumped timing and had to be towed back.

Update. They did honor their warranty and repaired the work that was done. They got it done quickly. The only guy that gave me a little issue was the front desk guy. But the owner stood by his word. And I respect that. Their are 2 reasons this is not 5 star. And one is the mechanic did not care enough to check what was throwing the new codes. P2004 and P2005. And what i mean by that was just eye balling it to see if it was anything obvious. But it was very simple. The wiring harness in the back was not clipped back into its holder and was blocking the control arms of the actuator from moving properly. Cleared codes and issue is fixed.
The 2nd thing is where my coils were in fact not replaced but the boots were replaced instead of the actual coil packs. It was way cheaper for me to just order all new preformance MSD coil packs (that come with new boots) . If anyone would like to buy my coil boots please hit me up. They are barely used and i have no need for rubber coil boots.

Over all glad to have my Mustang GT back.

He said with the amount of mIles on the vehicle he was almost certain the transfer case was fine. Sure enough THE SECOND OPINION IS WHAT I RECOMMEND IF YOU GONNA DEAL WITH THIS SHOP. The switch on the transfer case was bad and cost me $392 with parts and labor to fix. Then to top it all off they charged me $5 to use my credit card for their $75 fake diagnostic fee. resp.text: Jaquana I am sorry you feel this way, however there are a few reasons your oil change was more. 1) Your car required a synthetic oil change which was $47.95. 2) Your car required an air filter, we ask you if you wanted us to change it and gave you the price of the air filter which was $25.13, and you told us to go ahead and change it. 3) We topped off all of your fluids including antifreeze and windshield washer fluid. In regards to the 10% fee for using a debit card, that is just untrue. We have never charged anyone for using their card. I reviewed your ticket and I would be glad to discuss with you further please feel free to give me a call at 334-576-2248. Thank you.

name: Tracy Slough
text:
UPDATE: 4/28/2021
So I read their canned response that all unsatisfied reviewers get, and I followed the instructions to escalate the issue. I did receive an email, and then called the number specified (4/20/2021). I recounted my story to the customer service agent and was told I would receive a call from the person over our area within 24 to 48 hours. I’m still waiting. I haven’t heard another thing by phone or email from management. I don’t really expect to at this point. Just wanted to update so others would not think all of these issues were resolved.

I have used this location for more than 10 years to service my cars and buy tires.  They bought my loyalty by fixing a flat before I was a customer. Today, they have lost me as a customer. One of my daughters took her car in for the managers special oil change which includes a tire rotation. They did not do this service. This is the second car in a month that they did not rotate the tires when getting the oil changed. The tires for both were purchased at this store. Last month, sending my oldest daughter to get her oil changed, not only did they not rotate the tires, they tried to charge her for the high mileage synthetic oil change when she ordered the managers special when setting the appointment in the app. She only gave her information. When she picked up her car, the charge was over $60 for the upgraded service. When her father questioned why so much, they said the app doesn’t tell them which oil to use and they just have to make a judgment call. When he told them that I usually take care of this and to put in my information, they came back and apologized, issued a credit for the price difference, and gave us a free oil change. After what happened today, I no longer trust them to service my cars. I feel my daughter’s were taken advantage of and have warned them that this is what they face as young women. Also, as this is a corporate owned store, I will no longer recommend Pep Boys or trust any Pep Boys location with my vehicles.

resp.text: We’re sorry you had less than a 5 star experience. Please send us your contact info and the details of your experience to pepsocial@pepboys.com so that we can investigate further. Thank you

name: Go to hell
text:
If I could leave 0 starts I definitely would. Went to
Get my a/c checked out and they told me it was moisture in the system. Comes to find out it was the a/c compressor. Took my car to another shop and pep boys had clipped wires to the compressor which costed me more money in the end. And then they told me it would be $800 to find a genuine compressor because my car was built in Japan when it was literally built in Tennessee ( checked the vin #) and to add insult to injury I found oil in my intake box after they had my car. The oil wasn’t there before . It was FRESH OIL too. Scammers . Stay away and find another shop

name: Michael Herring
text:
I was headed to Pep Boys to get an alignment on my front end, when the engine light started to flash.

I told the tech I needed an alignment and to see if they could find out why the engine light was flashing. I know I needed spark plugs, but wanted them to see if it was anything worse.

An hour later, no alignment, and I was told I needed an engine because the number 2 cylinder wasn't getting any fire. I asked about the coil pack, wires, and plugs, but they were adament about me needing an engine.

I asked how much it would cost and the response was between $1800 to $2600.

After I left, I stopped by Advance Auto Parts and picked up plugs, coil pack, and cam sensor.

After waiting for the engine to cool, I spent about 45 minutes installing the parts. For less than $100, and now, I have no "flashing" engine light or error codes.

Anyone that lacked knowledge of how an engine works, would have spent quite a sum to fix an engine that had nothing wrong.

Needless to say, I won't ever take my vehicle to them again, for any type of service.

resp.text: Michael, We’re sorry you had less than a 5 star experience. Please send us your contact info and the details of your experience to pepsocial@pepboys.com so that we can investigate further. Thank you.

name: Janet Hall
text:
I just called this location to inquire about purchasing the same tires that I purchased from a different Pep Boys location in 2018 (2 years ago) happens to be the Falken ZE950. I wanted to know if they could honor the price I paid in 2018 which at that time the other location did a price match from another tire dealer to get my business. However the man that answered the phone  listen to my question and asked how much I paid and then  persisted to tell me that the entire series of that tire has been discontinued. He did offer to sell me a Starfire tire for the same price which was made by Cooper tire. After ending the call  I look on Pep Boys website, low and behold their  was the Falken ZE950. Then noticed the suggested Starfire tire he mentioned didn't even have a mileage warranty and it was actually cheaper than he was going to sell them to me. Clearly this locations business is doing so well right now they don't need any additional business.
So I called another location and they was very willing to have my business , the tire I want at the price we agreed on.
Skyland Pepboys you should be ashamed of how you treat potential customers. Very shady, non trust worthy staff. I will NEVER go to this location for anything.

name: Dina Wilson
text: I’m trying to figure out why I’m waiting an hour for an oil change after I made my appointment online. Maybe I’m just used to the awesome service I’ve received the past 15 years from the fantastic guys in Crisshaven Drive at Express. Unfortunately my husband has been driving my car lately and he didn’t get by there. However, I did receive my car as promised within the hour. I did feel really bad for a lady and her daughter that was told it would be an hour for two tires to be put on and she stated she had already been there longer than an hour when we arrived. I recommended she remind the manager that her car was still in the parking lot and Leland did go get her car and take it into one of the empty bays. I stood at the window and watched as my oil was being changed. I’m not sure the guy that changed my oil was very knowledgeable with tools. I’m sure I’ll know soon if he was or not. There was a lot of cell phone action going on with employees and one employee actually let the phone continue to ring up front as he went and found a charger (in the back) for his phone. I will definitely return to my safe place in Birmingham that is fast, efficient, honest and clean. I gave a four star review because Leland said it would take an hour when we arrived and we were out within an hour. But seriously you should be informed of this online when making an appointment. One thing I noticed as did the other lady and we both did not like... I have a 2019 car and when they finally came outside with my paperwork they WROTE (using a ball point pen) on the HOOD of my car. If my paint is scratched I’m going to be one mad lady! I guess I was raised that you don’t mess with other people’s property like that especially if it can damage. Noticed the guys in the back did the same thing (on the other side of my hood) when they were done. Ugh. Not ok with this new car owner. I worked hard to purchase my car and want to keep it looking nice.

resp.text: We’re very happy you’re satisfied with the work we do; our goal is to provide our customers with a service which surpasses all their expectations. Thank you for trusting us. We’re looking forward to keeping your business.

We asked the associate why they advertise 7pm closing time, and he said they stop taking cars at 6pm so they can close.

Pep Boys took 5 minutes and fixed my tire. We will be purchasing our tires from Pep Boys in the future!!!

text: Was in town on business and discovered I had a pretty major oil leak. Popped in and described what was going; they were super busy. The manager, Leland, walked next door to O’reillys and brought me back over and said they didn’t want me to attempt to drive with that. Turns out the oil change I just got was not a good one and the oil pan did not get fastened all of the way. Definitely could of rattled loose and popped out completely if I attempted to drive south. Overall, just amazing customer service and was definitely a WOW experience and was greatly appreciated! Thank you all!!

text: Had new tire pressure sensors installed on my wife’s 09’ Pontiac G8 GT. I purchased the sensors myself and called and talked with Alvin to see if they would install them for me. Alvin said he would check and came back and said sure they are finishing up on another now. While waiting he checked the sensors I had purchased with the sensor tool to make sure they all worked before installing. After a little over one hour they were done and we were good to go. The total price to install was even less than he had quoted over the phone, very professional and will be back.

name: David J Hutchins
text: Great customer service and actually backs up their work. I took my 2012 Kia Forte to a Pep Boys in Orange Beach, AL for an AC repair. After a couple of months though, the AC started to get warm again and was not working correctly. After calling the Orange Beach location, they sent me over to my local Pep Boys on Skyland and I took it there. After figuring out it needed more freon, they topped it up and added dye just in case its leaking. This was all free due to the warranty and they also changed my cabin air filter free of charge. I have zero complaints with the guys at Pep Boys, and they may be the most honest and well mannered people in the auto repair industry. Pep Boys will now be my go to shop for automotive repairs I am not able to do myself. I was hesitant due to the low rating on google, but I was pleasantly surprised.

resp.text: That's great to hear! Thank you for letting us know and we hope to see you again!

name: L A (Tute4sho)
text: I took my 2003 Honda Accord for a full diagnosis because I had an oil leak and loss of power. Once I went to pick up the car he showed me a piece of paper that had 3 codes on it, and that's it. The same exact 3 codes I got from Oreillys the day before for free. So I asked him did you look for the leak or did he check my fuel injectors he said no, he just stopped looking for stuff once he saw those codes because that's almost $1600.00. So my problem is this, I paid you to tell me what's wrong with my car, not to determine if you think it's worth fixing. I wanted a full inspection of my engine that's why I paid $90. I paid $90 for absolutely nothing.

name: Daisy Mickens
text: Took a 07 Buick Lucerne to Pepboys on Skyland Blvd in Tuscaloosa, AL to have right tie rod end and other issues with the side replaced. Before taking the car there it never hesitated to start and the battery was never drained. After 2 days there received a call that the car was ready my fiancé, my daughter and I arrived to pay for the repairs and pick up the car. Attempted to start the car but it wouldn’t crank we proceed back into the office to advise the Manager that the car wouldn’t start. He had one of his mechanics to take a handheld battery charger to the car to start it. While charging the battery he says try to crank the car and when my fiancé turned the key there was a spark and it blew the radio, charged it a little more and the car cranked. As he traveled home the car was having issues with ABS and other warning lights, he made it home and the following morning on his way to work the same issues happened and he barely made it to work when it shut down and wouldn’t start, that evening had it towed to Pepboys and they determined that the computer was not working. Now they says that he must have had someone jump the car off, yes you guys jumped it off was his response but they said they knew better than to do that. After paying 1200+ to have the initial issues repaired they said they can fix it for 300+.

resp.text: We apologize that you had a poor experience.  Please allow us to review your experience by sending us your contact info and details of your visit to pepsocial@pepboys.com and we will investigate further. Thank you.

text:
I was trusting this place and doing all my car maintenance there like changing oils and brake pads. Early April, I was visiting Dallas and wanna change my oil there, and my mechanic guy was saying I lost one of my wheel lug nuts. Cannot imaging I was driving 600 miles away!! And then we found out that my OEM oil drain plug has been worn out due to rude work. And one more thing is, my car's cover of oil drain was lost, and the bottom part was naked. Should I blame all these horrible things to Pepboys?

Updates: PepBoys got touch with me and reimbursed the fee that I did pay for fixing my oil drain panel. I am very satisfied with their attitude afterwards.

I then was informed by my Grand that the car was shaking really bad..I drove the poorly running car Home.with intent to be at Pep Boys Monday morning.   On that Monday Morning I arrived with Vehicle and demanded that they fix a problem that they created.I was first in line.approximately 1::00   I called them while sitting in there parking lot.the car was sitting outside with the hood up.They had no update.At 2::00 I received a call a was informed that # three cylinder had a bad Fuel injector and ignition  coil with fouled spark plug.Cost for this repair $500.00  I have never dealt with such a den of thIves in my lifetime,  I'm 70. I payed the cost by phone to provide my 8 month pregnant Granddaughter transportation .I will continue to fight this ( license to steal operations) until they operate honestly or close their doors.  I strongly advise everyone to stay away from this place at all cost.If you break down near pep boys, push it or have it towed away from them.

name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

name: Julie Hughes
text:
I had an appointment for an oil change at 10:00 am. I was told that it would be ready in a couple of hours.  I left my car for 4 hours. When I arrived at 2 pm, Kyle didn’t know about my car. When he finally found the paperwork, he said,”they can put it on the rack now.”  I informed him that I had to be home by 3 pm and I live an hour away and to please just bring me my keys. He brought my keys, rudely handed them to me and said,”Bye.”
I was not rude to him. I did tell him that this happened before and that I just needed my keys.
I am more disappointed in the way he handled this. He never once apologized and seemed annoyed that I couldn’t wait.  I think 4 hours is plenty of time for a 15 min. oil change.
Customer service goes a long way!

name: Dorothy Carter
text: I was in the service  department  yesterday  I had another  service   associate. I hate too give a  bad review because  I have been  dealing  with  Nissan  since  2014 this associate  name is ADAM. MONTGOMERY he doesn't have good customer  service  skills. I watch  the other  associate  come in and out and communicate  with customers.He never communicate  beyond checkin.This was first  time the lady a the desk call too sign out for my car.I had go back in tooask for the oil sticker that goes in the window. He did enforce. me my car was ready. Maybe he was upset because  I told him I didn't  need a tire rotation  because I DID one the last visit .I just purchase  this car in August  last year. Next time I will get someone else in the service  department  not him. I Jim Burke  Nissan Sales and Service But Adam Montgomery  is not a good  associate .

name: Beth Jeszka
text:
If I could give negative stars I would. I dropped my 2005 Nissan Titian off to have some recall work completed, diagnostics ran, O2 sensors replaced and an oil change. I used one of their rental cars, as the truck would not be finished for several days. I left my truck, after giving them a budget of $1500.00, got on to the interstate and went about my day. I woke up in the morning and the car was not there. I talked it over with my roommate and we agreed i should call the police. Long story short, I tried calling Nissan to let them know the situation. I left several messages, tried calling my appointed service tech, sent an email and even had a conversation with the online chat. This happened Wednesday night- Thursday. I finally received a response, via email, stating my truck was finished. Total cost was just over $300.00. The recall work was covered, the cost was for the rental. All of the work I requested to have completed was not finished. The invoice didn't even reflect my request, the issues my truck is having or why I brought to them. In true honesty, they did complete the recall issues.
I will be staying with Benton Nissan or my personal mechanic, lesson learned.

name: Kayti ackerman

text: This is by far the BEST Nissan service department I have ever had experience with. We own 3 Nissans our teenage/college kids drive and have about 25 Nissans in our company fleet. Ron was absolutely amazing helping our two sons who broke down just outside of Birmingham while driving back to Florida from Mississippi. If you want your vehicle worked on by a company that is honest and goes above and beyond this is the service department to go to! Thank you Ron and Jim Burke Nissan! What a top-notch company!

I knew it was going to take at least a week and a half to fix my vehicle but, it literally has been 3 weeks that my truck has been in the shop with no updates. I've been told it will be ready 4 different days and my vehicle is still isn't ready. Are they not on a schedule with what vehicles comes in first gets service first? I spoke the Service dept mgr Ron today (9/8) at around 2 p.m and he was suppose to give me a call but it's 4:30 and still no call. Customer Service sucks, finishing in a timely manner is definitely some bull$***
Update: Picked up my SUV on 9/10 everything seems to going good. Mr Ron the service dept mgr made sure my truck was ready before he just handed to me. If it wasn't for him I probably would've have them 0 stars.

name: Jacqoura Towns
text: Very horrible service after my radiator was replaced. I was told to continue to put water in my car which I shouldn't  have had to do that if it was replaced with a brand new radiator. For the price I spent it better have been brand new. Smh waste of money and drive and my car is still messed up. Never again will I ever visit this location or any of them because of this bad experience.

resp.text:
Hello Jacqoura, we're disappointed to see your review, but we wanted to take the time to clarify the situation. When you brought your vehicle in to have the CV axle and P/S pump replaced, you noted that your engine overheated on the way to the location. Our service technician discovered a large leak in your radiator, which you agreed to have replaced. When you let us know that your vehicle had overheated again, we discussed with you the possibility of a damaged head gasket that was causing the overheating. We believe that this is the cause of the problem and suggested adding water to prevent it from overheating while you are needing to move the vehicle. We would be happy to take a look for you, as we believe this is the cause of the overheating issue. Please let us know if we can help you with this repair. Thank you, Jacqoura.
Chris, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Julius Matthews
text:
I'm not a very car saavy guy, but do know customer service. I signed up for an appointment through USAA RepairPal and thought that this place would have integrity. I was wrong.

I took it in one week. That Friday I had to call THEM to get an update on a Lexus IS350. They told me they did a few test and had more to run. The following Tuesday they informed me that the control head need to be replaced. I told them I didn't want the work done. At that moment, not the Friday I called them, not the day I brought it to them, but that Tuesday I was informed that I would be charged $45 everyday the car remained there. Why wouldn't you inform someone of this at the initial dropoff?

So I get there and fortunately I was not charged the $45. I try to leave and the vehicle, which only the AC wasn't working and the TPS light was on. When I get the vehicle back my parking brake light, check engine light, power steering light, and my ABS light was all of a sudden on.

I used them through USAA and this is how they are with customers. Poor.

resp.text:
Hello Julius, we were disappointed to see your review. When you came in late to your appointment, we were happy to still accommodate you and take your vehicle in, and we tried to communicate that we weren't sure how long the services would take due to the schedules of our expert technicians. You seemed to understand this at the time, and you signed the storage fee disclaimer. When you called on Thursday, you said that you would pick the car up on Friday and return for the repairs on Monday. You didn't come in on Friday or Monday, so Tuesday, we called to remind you of the storage fee. We're sorry if any of the paperwork wasn't clear, and we were happy to waive the fee for you when you came to pick up your car on Thursday. We explained the repairs your car needs (which is why your warning lights are on), but we would be happy to go over this information with you again if you have any questions. We wish you the best.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

text: Paid for a diagnosis on my brakes which was $40. Wanted to charge me 482+ tax for 2 rotors and brakes and said they wanted to take my old brake fluid out and put some new in,check my emergency brake and charged labor for each thing he was going to install. So after i talked it over with my granddad he told me to leave. i told them i couldn’t afford the price and then he tried to take the price down and take the brake flush and checking my back brakes off it came down to 373+tax  i thought about but i still declined. After that they did not say thank you for coming or anything. just gave me my keys. this is the second time this has happened trying to over charge don’t go here! go to tire engineers. i ended up having a friend doing my brakes paid for parts which was wayyy cheaper thank god ! Also my brake fluid was clean and did not need changing so they lied about that as well, and checking for my emergency brake ? nobody rides on there emergency brake. since i’m a young woman they will try and rip you off be careful ladies .!

name: Alesha Hicks
text: Sure, they were nice and did the work, but when I got my itemized receipt checked by an independent mechanic from a different garage, their prices were way more than what should have been charged. The biggest one being that they charged for taking broken parts off, which is part of the work that goes into fixing it and would not be charged elsewhere (which was confirmed by another trusted mechanic my family has gone to for years). Get a quote and get it checked by someone else before you agree to the work.

resp.text:
Dear Alesha,
We sincerely appreciated the opportunity to work with you recently to perform brake maintenance on your vehicle. The brake pads that had been previously installed by another mechanic had several broken parts that needed to be addressed. We spent over an hour trying to salvage existing parts in order to save you the expense of new calipers. Our invoice showed we only charged a portion of the hourly labor rate to keep your costs down. I would be happy to discuss all of this further with you and address your concerns in a positive manner. Please give Jamie, the owner, a call at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience.

name: Christopher Houston

name: Beverly Ashley
text: They recommended I get rear wheel bearings on my vehicle. My car made awful noises after the work was done, I took the car to them twice after and they still did not fix it. I had another mechanic fix the car which was the same thing the left wheel bearings. Don't take your vehicle here, they aren't trustworthy at all and cannot even fix what they mess up.

resp.text:
Dear Beverly,
Thanks for coming into our auto shop recently. We were surprised by your review since we provided you with effective communication and excellent customer service. We replaced your wheel bearing and discovered a small evac leak. You also had us replace a headlight bulb and rotate your tires.

When you came back the next day and stated you were hearing a noise, our technician, Chris, took the car for a test drive and diagnosed you needed a new tire. You left our shop and purchased a used tire and then had us install it. The next day you came back and stated you were still hearing the same noise. Chris drove the car again and indicated that the used tire was no good. We even moved the used tire to the back to make sure the noise followed the tire, which it did.

Our team did exactly what was asked of us and provided you with an honest assessment of what your vehicle needed. We wish you all the best.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Darlene Strong
text: Micheal and his supervisor was so ugly to me. I will never go back to them. Not once did they call me about my car to let me know what was going on and when I called them they just said you can come and it. All it need is a sensor.

resp.text:
Darlene, we're sorry to see that you had a bad experience at our store. We aren't always able to let our customers know how long work on their vehicle will last, as we aren't always sure what repairs will be needed. We apologize that there was a delay in figuring out what was wrong with the vehicle, but we unfortunately had vehicles ahead of you that needed to be taken care of first. Our goal is always to meet our customers' expectations, and we regret that we weren't able to help more. We wish you the best and hope you were able to find the service you needed.
Chris, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: Rocky and Beverly McCurdy
text: Wanted to do a new review since they replied and lied on my other one. This shop lied and said I bought a used tire and brought it to them to put on after they told me that’s what I needed to stop a noise that they caused. Good used tires down the street replaced my tire not you all. I really need you all to stick with one lie. They also doctored paperwork saying I came up there earlier this year then sent out another letter saying I didn’t.  These people are CROOKS I promise you that. I’ve been told if they find out someone else fixes your car, they pay other mechanics that people take their cars to to fix the damage they did to avoid going to court. Good things don’t come to those who lie and don’t do right by people.

name: Laura Vines
text: I took my Subaru in for an oil change.  I asked them to look at the brakes to make sure they were good since it had been awhile.  The guy told me I needed rear brakes, and offered me a good price.  I could not afford it at the time, so I waited.  In the meantime, I spoke to a co-worker, who said, "OMG, don't go there!  I was there really recently and overheard the employees talking about one of the guys there who was so bad and told people they needed work they didn't need done, and were joking about it.!"  So I took it to another place for a second opinion, and they said I did not need brakes!  So buyer, beware.  I put one star because I had to put a star to post this, but I would not put any stars if that was an option!

resp.text:
Dear Laura,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. We appreciate your review and have looked into the issue you raised. We are a family owned automotive center and we strongly enforce providing our customers with an honest assessment of their vehicle needs. We treat all vehicles like our own and value each customer’s time and money. We are sorry if you were not satisfied with your last visit to our center and welcome the opportunity to discuss all of this with you. Thank you very much!

name: travia thomas
text: We just left the shop 30mins ago & when we made it home my belt started making a strange noise. We open the hood to find the oil stick wasn't closed all the way and a drill was stuck in between my belt and melt under my hood.... Wow I hope my belt isn't ruined and I have no future problems!

resp.text:
Hello Travia,
We appreciated the opportunity to service your vehicle for you. Shortly after you left our auto center, our technician noticed one of this tools was missing and we called you immediately to confirm the tool was still under your hood. You indicated you had the missing tool and our manager sincerely apologized for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We really appreciated you bringing the tool back to our shop the next day. Once you arrived, we were happy to inspect the belt and pulleys and found no damage. This was good news.

It was our pleasure to adjust your tire pressure and also install your fog lamp bulb at no charge, to compensate for our mishap. Everything seemed fine when you left our shop and you thanked us for our assistance, so we are a bit confused by this negative review. We are happy to discuss this with you anytime, and encourage you to contact one of the owners, Rick or Jamie Martin, at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

name: Eli Ashley
text: Easily the worst car shop I've ever been to. I would suggest going here if you want to see 5 mechanics chilling in the back room while 1 guy does most of the work. I've been here three times and they've all been awful. The most recent time I went I got an oil change. Not even a week later my car started acting funny and my change engine oil light came on. I looked at the preferred date to return and it said 2/30/2016. If they don't even know how many days are in February I don't see how anyone would expect them to properly fix cars.

resp.text:
Dear Eli,
We are very sorry to read that you are not happy with our automotive services and that you are experiencing auto issues. Our oil change sticker is generated by a computer and it sounds like it was a simple error that created the incorrect February date. We welcome the opportunity to discuss what happened and try to reach a positive outcome. Please contact the owners, Jamie and Rick Martin at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. We look forward to speaking with you. Thank you!

text: I dont know much about cars but I came to this shop for a problem that was temporarily fixed turned out they missed what was really going on i always keep my receipt so i showed my new shop the work i had done and the new shop Im at told me what they missed im done... wasted 400 to not get my problem fixed I heard bad things about this shop its all true dont waste your time or money

name: Charitee Truss
text: I let them put my heater core in 3 days ago my car was running good just didn't have heat now I have no car to drive cause it barely cranks and cuts off every 5 mins but the workers can't tell me what's wrong this ain't right somebody please help me I had my own brand new heater core and antifreeze they charge 180 for labor extra 80 for hoses now I'm out a car

resp.text:
I am very sorry to read that your vehicle is not performing adequately, Mrs. Truss. I checked our records and we were happy to replace the heater core you provided on your 1992 Chevy Caprice. After assessing the car, we recommended replacing the other heater core and hoses, which you agreed. The car was still not performing well after the second assessment, so we then recommended replacing the throttle body. You asked to take the car for a second opinion, and let us know they provided you with the same assessment; the throttle body needed replacing. We stand behind all work where the parts are provided by Precision Tune Auto Care, with a 12 month guarantee. I am happy to work with you to find an affordable and honest resolution to get your car running in a reliable manner. You can reach me at (205) 945-8863. I look forward to talking with you soon. Thank you.
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Mel M
text: On Jan 19, 2019 at about 1pm I took my car to this Precision.  If I could give zero stars I would.  They were to fix a Cv boot leak and replace pads on my front breaks.  The employee got into a car accident and damaged my car.  In addition, the break work was incomplete.  I had to after waiting over 5 hours immediately return to them for noises in the breaks.  But back to the accident, the police took statements from the witnesses.  The report states it was Precision Tune and Auto care at fault.  The employee even stated he was sorry and didnt see the other driver.  They were intially so appologetic. When I tried to contact Precision about repairs the manager Chris said he was waiting on the police report.  I kindly had my insurance make a copy for him and delivered it to him.  I call week later again asking what will happen or if someone will contact me.  He gives a different story getting short with me and saying they arent responsible for anything.  I asked if his company's insurance co will call me he got short with me.  I have complained to corporate but since this is an independent franchise their hands are tied so they say.  They charged me 584 for work performed and my car still has issues and damage to the body because of the employee's negligence and nobody is willing to fix the issue.  Who wrecks your car and then tells you their not responsible.  Well the manager Chris did.

name: Justin Hamilton
text:
I WILL NOT DO THIS AGAIN.

SOOOOOO...where to begin. So this is my third visit to this campus, and needless to say, I'M PISSED. In a twenty-four hour period, I've seen this place three time, with minimum 1.5 hour wait, except for today. I come in the third time for the oil change with tire rotation, and I am denied service same day for the rotation. Ask for the same discount on tire rotations with oil changes since I have to come..even back again, and I am denied that. I understand business is jumping, but I would've been fine with a 50% off (normally $60), but can't even do that. Being a customer here the last minimum 5 years, this has to be the worst service and answer I've received, definitely when I'm spending my time to come and patronize, and giving chance after chance.

name: P Teague
text:
This place just tried to charge me 546.00 for a tune up!!!!! 36.00 per spark plug, &226.00 for labor!!!! I went and bought my spark plugs for 46.00(all six) and  the mechanic isn't charging a third of the price they are asking! This is highway robbery!!!!

Then I called another Precision Auto Tune and was quoted almost $200 less for the same service on the same car what in the heck is going on at that Homewood location that is really sad $200 more that is so ridiculous!!!!!

text: I was freaked out by the negative reviews for this place, but the price was good so I figured I could give it a try. My experience was no fuss and fast, and I'm glad I gave it a try after all.

We are so happy to you gave us a try as well. It was our pleasure to provide you with an excellent experience at our auto shop. Thanks so much for your business.
Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Katherine Miller
text: I wish I did not even have to give one star as this place is so awful. I have paid close to $1,500 in repairs here just for my axle to break because it was not properly repaired. Now that another mechanic has my vehicle he told me the control arms were put on incorrectly causing further damage to the car, the sway bar linkage was held by electrical tape, and I'm lucky I didn't lose control of my car and kill myself driving it in the condition WHICH I PAID WELL TO HAVE FIXED! It is not only completely shady and unethical but dangerous. I hope someone sues this place and gets them shut down before they kill somebody! Seriously, don't take your car here unless you want a near death experience.

resp.text:
Dear Katherine,
We are very sorry to read that your recent visit to our Precision Tune Auto Care center did not meet your expectations. It is our sincere intention to provide every customer with exceptional service. We are very proud to offer a 12 month, 12,000 mile warranty on all services, when the parts are provided by our center. We were happy to allow you to provide your own parts for us to install and our team recommended other services, noted on your inspection sheet. The axle is under warranty and we look forward to working with you in order to find a positive resolution. Please contact Rick at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!

name: Tashona Reese
text: Seems I'm not the only person who's gotten ripped off at this location. I was charged $800.00 for a Brake job. I paid because I was told my brakes were at 10% and having started a new job across town, I didn't want to take a chance to continue driving on them. The staff was super friendly as long as they got their money but, when I called the next day to inquire about how they price their parts, of course nobody knew anything. I left my number for the manager to call me back, this was in September, 2015 and I still have not received a call. I also reached out to corporate and they informed me that it's out of their hands because each location is independently owned, but they would however forward my complaint/ info on to the regional maanger, who I have yet to hear from. I have no problem paying for services rendered, but I do have a problem when businesses are shady.Do not go to this location.

resp.text:
Dear Tashona,
My name is Rick Martin and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham. I read your recent review and am sorry that you feel we overcharged you. We went over all of the costs with you before beginning the service on your vehicle and you approved everything. We do not wish to lose your business, so please contact me to discuss this further and hopefully we can find a positive resolution. I tried to contact you and got only as far as voicemail. I look forward to hearing from you. Thank you, Rick (205) 760-9904!

name: Valerie Garner
text: Last oil change I had was done they were in a rush. When they were done. They handed me  unfilled diagonsed I guess test of what was wrong with my car. I would of liked to know what problems my car needs repairs to. It's an older aution car. So I was looking forward to fix the major problems. But instead I didn't receive a through reading

name: v bee
text: After reading all the negative reviews. Hello Concerned Parent, I wanted to let you know that we are very sorry that you felt like your daughter was not taken care of to your satisfaction. I am a parent too, and I truly understand the value of a trustworthy vehicle for our children to drive, especially when they go away to college.

I spoke with our manager and he tested the battery when your daughters vehicle was towed to our shop. Our testing indicated the battery was defective and also showed swelling on the side. When a new battery was installed, the car started and your daughter was able to drive it once again.

We are a family owned auto shop that takes great pride in providing each customer with honest, affordable, and friendly car maintenance. I would be more than happy to discuss all of this with you, in hopes of reaching an amicable solution. Please contact me at (205) 945-8863 at your earliest convenience, or provide me with the best way to reach you and the best time to call at the following email address: jmartin@ptacit.com. I look forward to talking with you. Thank you.
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

name: Danny Vines
text: These people will rip you off. Charge you for parts and service that you don't need and take advantage of people in desperate situations. Stay away from this place at all costs.

resp.text:
I am saddened that your recent experience at our auto center did not exceed your expectations, Danny. We work very hard to provide each customer with honest, affordable and professional auto maintenance solutions. We towed your 2000 Jeep Cherokee to our shop after you could not get it started at a local gas station. After running a few diagnostic tests we concluded the starter was bad and you agreed to have it replaced. Once that was done we continued with our testing and also recommended replacing the ignition switch, which you also agreed to have replaced. When asked if we could put the old starter back into the vehicle, we recommended not doing this, since our comprehensive testing showed the old starter was bad. Autozone ran a test on the old starter as well and came to the same conclusion; the old starter was bad and should not be reinstalled.  I am happy to work with you to get your vehicle back on the road and can be reached at the number shown below. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham
(205) 945-8863

name: Alonzo Coats Jr

name: Frank Buchanan Jr. (VooDoo)
text:
The employees of this location is not well versed in customer satisfaction and have a tendacy to have a sharp mouth. One of the store managers has manhood issues and thinks that all should bow down into him when he's nothing but pie. His name is Chris and have been employed by Precision multiple times...he has been known to steal cash from the register and also, had a bad drug habit as well. I'd strongly advise that you take your vehicle elsewhere. The owner of this Precision also has other locations around town and he doe not care about truth concerning how his business is ran but rather gotten money hungry at the expense of his employees and the customers.  Nor is their word any good for they tell you what you wanna hear but not man enough to deliver. All Precision Tune locations need to be under new management or close their doors for good.
I speak this in truth for I was once employed with this establishment. I'm an ASE Master Certified Diesel & Gas Technician...yet was treated with disrespect and was lied to about the pay scale. I've seen firsthand the deceit & trickery of staff. Nor do they abide by standards placed before them in order to maintain a respectable business. Of course there's more to the story but enough has been said to bring the customers awareness up..for it is my duty & obligation to expose such when at the customers expenses.
It speaks volumes when you bring things to their attention yet they fail to acknowledge you or allow an explanation....so I chose to terminate my employment and since then...I've been trying to contact those in charge so that I may retrieve my other toolbox at the Pelham location but have yet been able to. Goes to show the level of care when they lose a highly trained technician because the so called service manager has no real knowledge of automobiles but is allowed to make decisions above his experience...but I'm being hindered in accessing all my tools since i can't the owners to meet me there to get my belongings. The Pelham store momentarily closed due to lack of business but yet they don't see as to why when it's self evident.
Please take your business elsewhere...even if it's to one like Hellen Keller...you'd have a better chance of getting professional lasting repairs.

Attention to management: I need my tools from the Pelham location and have notified Chris and txt Rick only to receive absolutely no reply. If interested in the truth....please contact me....

resp.text:
Hello Frank,
We always appreciate receiving reviews from our valued customers based on services received. Since you have not been a customer at our auto shop, I believe this review in in direct violation of the Google Review Guidelines which state: "Off-topic reviews: Don’t post reviews based on someone else’s experience, or that are not about the specific place you’re reviewing. Reviews aren’t meant to be a forum for general political or social commentary or personal rants.” We kindly ask that you remove this review from our Google page. I am happy to make sure you have all of your tools mentioned, and encourage you to please contact Jamie at (205) 945-8863 to make arrangements. Thank you!
Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham

They stole my wedding band a watch my father gave me which is sentimental value and a bag of change that I keep in my console... what loooooo looooooo looooooo LOOOOOSERS. FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF for effort for this place. And I seen lots of other bad reviews as well where they wrecked an individuals car.... Guess that's y they are not BBB registered!!! Do not go here they will find you over.

resp.text:
Dear ra duhon,
I am sorry to read our services did not meet your expectations and wanted to respond to your review. When you first came to us we were happy to repair the issue with the main seal with parts you provided. When we install parts from the customer, they are not covered by any warranty. We reviewed all of our security tapes and found no foul play regarding items removed from your vehicle while on our premises. Since we could not seem to find a positive resolution, a release was signed by you stating a full refund was provided, and all maintenance was performed to your satisfaction. Throughout this entire process we have shown extreme patience and honesty and have kept in continuous communication with you to try and resolve this to your satisfaction. We wish you all the best!
~ Rick, Precision Tune Auto Care owner

resp.text:
Dear Tiffy,
We are sorry to read that you are experiencing automotive issues. Our records indicate when the vehicle was brought to us, the engine was running hot from the fan not working and we also detected metal shavings in the coolant system. We recommended repairing both issues at a very fair price, and you asked us to only replace the fan. Our main goal for all of our customers is to provide honest and affordable automotive repair solutions and stand behind our work, which we feel we did throughout this entire process. We are more than happy to discuss all of this further with you in hopes of reaching a reasonable solution. Please contact our Precision Tune Auto Care center at (205) 945-8863. Thank you!
~ Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Birmingham

My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care in Birmingham. We were happy to perform an oil change and top off your fluids for you. Our initial inspection of your vehicle indicated you needed the following maintenance; brake inspection, CV Axle replaced, cracks found in a belt, and multiple oil leaks. Our team performed the oil change and you asked us to wait on the remaining items. We encourage you to give us a call at (205) 945-8863 to discuss your recent visit and also to make an appointment to have the rest of the maintenance performed. We look forward to speaking with you. Thank you!

text: I'm from Kentucky and was in Spanish Fort visiting family. I had a tire losing air. They got me right in and fixed it. Clean waiting area. I recommend this location.

name: John Wilkerson
text: I understand how impactful ratings and reviews can be so I rarely rate or review because I do not want my singular bad experience to impact someone else’s decision. However, all I can think of is how my singular bad experience may help someone avoid spending thousands of dollars on an issue. I recently took my vehicle in because it was not running properly. The called me back stating “we think we know the issue because our technician had a car like this once and this is how he fixed it”. That statement should never come from your mechanic. There is TOO MUCH technology available today for mechanics to be guessing. Even if the mechanic knows emphatically what the problem is based on their experience, they can confirm with technology. But, I needed the car so I asked how much this would cost, he said “$450 and this does not guarantee a fix, this is just where we need to start...” I asked if I’d get a refund on anything that was done and did not fix my issue, he replied with no. I asked if codes were generated and he replied with yes and told me what they were. I declined service, paid for an oil change that was needed and for the diagnostics fee. Googled the code, watched a video on how to diagnose the code, ordered the part on Amazon(18$) and repaired it myself in less than 1 hour including diagnosis. I will never take my vehicle to this facility or another Goodyear as long as I can avoid it.

name: Hornaday quickfire
text: Pretty good service. Took my car in for a basic brake job, they started out I needed $1800 repairs done. Ended up paying $450 for oil change and basic brake/rotor job. All of these service/repair/mechanic shops can be pricey....just remember it's a business. Staff was very good and professional.

And of course this was a single woman who did not know much about the car, but knew better than to just say yes. Shame on you for trying to take advantage of people.

text: I would give zero stars if could, because that's exactly how much service I received. Had a 2pm appointment for oil change, showed up at 1:45pm. He said they would get right on it. I thought it was complete, and asked why no one let me know. He informed me that they hadn't even touched it yet. I asked for my keys, and voiced my displeasure. He handed me my keys, and never once offered any kind  of apology . Why take appointments if you have no intention of honoring it?!

resp.text: Thank you for the alert, Shaun. We definitely respect your time & take your feedback seriously. We do get backed up from time to time, but the team should be providing updates throughout to let you know of any unexpected delays. That being said, we'd like to connect & learn more. If possible, please send your preferred method of contact to support@tirediscounters.com. Once received, a member of the team will reach out. We value your insight and hope to chat soon.

name: Daniel Webster
text: I purchased almost 2 thousand dollars worth of tires from this location for a 2008 dodge dually in September 2020. On February 15th 2021 I took truck in for a rotation and brake inspection. They did the rotation wrong and put two tires that were worn way down and put on outer tears which started skinning them fast. Less than 200 miles down the road and the rear brake pads were metal on metal yet they supposedly just did a brake inspection. Today I took truck back so they could address the issues they cause and they wanted me to pay for their errors. I was fine with covering costs of brakes but the tires was their error. They did want to take care of me the customer. I picked my truck up and will leave this same review on every site I can find and contact an attorney Monday morning to address this matter.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Daniel. We've got an open ticket for ya in our system and we'll be in touch to get to the bottom of this soon. Make sure to send us your contact info if you haven't already done so to support@tirediscounters.com. Talk soon.

text:
I made an 8 am appointment to get one tire changed. I learned don’t ever make an 8 am appointment. It’s 830 and my truck still hasn’t even been pulled in so now I have to scramble to reschedule meetings this morning. Use discount tire instead they keep their appointment times and don’t have people laying out tire displays instead of taking care of customers. Then when they get it in and go to put the new tire on the guy stands there for 5 minutes texting instead of installing my tire....over an hour and a half for one tire as the first appointment of the day and first one signed in.

DO NOT USE FIND SOMEWHERE BETTER

text: These guys are incredible. ALL OF THEM! I have always gone to Discount Tires ...up until now.  I have never met a bunch of guys with better customer service than these guys. Each and every one of them genuinely cared about our situation and never stopped trying to help us figure it out and get us back on the road. These guys went out of there way and took care of us and got what we needed done.  If I even lived in a 50 mile radius of this store and these guys they would have my business all day long. I cant say enough about these guys... it makes me feel really good that there are still people like this on this planet.  Don't go anywhere else, I can promise you that theres nobody else going to take care of you better than they can.

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

name: Nicole Guyton
text: Excellent customer service ! I was out with my daughter, and the tire light came on pulled in to another facility they said it would be a couple of hours they were busy. I then drove to tire discounters and pulled in to see if I could get air in my tires. The service guy filled up my tires, but informed me I had a nail in one of my tires. Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

text: I had an emergency situation on the road when my tire pressure indicator warned me of low pressure. I found a tire leaking from tread separation and immediately raced to their shop. I'm glad they were close by and willing to bargain. I liked the experience so much that I went back the same week for a set of tires on my other car. Their shop is clean and I look forward to going back for rotations, balance jobs, and alignments for the life of my tires.

name: Tange Awbrey
text: We have been here multiple times and treated badly every time. The last straw was when the manager promised to take in both of our vehicles in one day. He specifically told us to drop off the first vehicle, then he would take the second one once our first vehicle was finished. When we came to pick up the first car, the same manager acted like we had two heads and told us he couldn't service our second vehicle since they were too busy. It really irritates me when people make promises they can't keep. When we explained why we were upset, we just got brushed off and told to have a nice day. Their customer service is very poor and I will be taking my business to Tire Engineers. I've been treated like a valued customer each time I have visited their locations.

text: I have not had very good luck with the Sam's Tire Center at this location. I purchased my tires at a different store, but since moving to Huntsville, I have had all of my balancing done here. Sadly, most of the employees here are not very skilled when it comes to balancing, but that doesn't stop them. If you have wheels that you would like to keep in good condition, don't go to Sam's. These guys use conventional weights that wreak havoc on allow wheels when mounted externally, which they do. The last time I was here, the shop tech that was helping me replaced one of my wheels without its center cap. I walked back into the shop and asked that he find the missing cap. He did find it, but had I not inspected his work in the parking lot, I'm sure that it would have been thrown away, and I'd be driving around without one. Lazy!

name: Michaela Robbins
text: The worst experience I've ever had getting tires. I would leave zero stars if I could. I purchased 4 tires online because of their low price. I went to get them put on 3 different times each time they had over 2 hour wait. Then when I finally decided to do it it took them over an hour to just locate my tires that were ordered online. I specifically told them I wanted my tires back when checking out. Three hours later when my car was finished they said they had cut up my previous tires and I wouldn't want them back. I had looked at my tires the day before going and there were at least 10,000 miles left on them. They preceded to show me tires that were worn until the belts were showing, which were not the tires I drove in there with. I would not recommend this Walmart tire center to my worst enemy.

Went in for one tire. Somehow the 3 people behind me in line, from the beginning, got their tires mounted and were on their way, yet I am still waiting. Standard size tire (235/75/15) subpar service.
I WILL NOT be returning. Even if I have a flat, this Walmart won't see a penny of the cost or a second of my time.

After already waiting 2 hours the 1st time I went in and then having to wait 2 1/2 hours the 2nd time I am done with this location.  There were workers just standing around while a line of cars waited to be worked on. I heard several complaints from folks sitting around me and have to say everything I heard was true. The dept. seems very disorganized when it comes organizing the flow of cars in the bays to be worked on. Only 1 person was working the counter and they seemed very overwhelmed .

name: Gaines Coker
text: Our state requires emissions. Our Honda Accord failed the State Emissions. I called around and Bodiford's Automotive gave me a quote for our service and repairs that were comparable to what we were expecting. Mr. Bodiford communicated to me up front what they were going to do with the car and when I should bring it in since I was from out-of-town. Mr. Bodiford & Auto Tech both drove the car after servicing to make sure the Check Engine Light did not appear. Mr. Bodiford, Auto Tech, and staff communicated with me the entire time keeping me abreast while servicing out automobile. I have recommnended Bodiford's Automotive to my extended family in the greater Mobile and Pensacola areas.

text: I had a problem with a sensor code after running through high water during the recent hurricane.   Frank's people dried out the circuits, cleared the code and my car is running great.  These mechanics are honest, efficient and professional.

resp.text: Thanks for choosing us. We appreciate you!

name: Ryan Slaby
text: My mustang overheated, and some of the spark plugs stripped the threads. Bodifords identified the problems and did a fantastic job! My car is running like new! Price was excellent considering how much work they had to do. They kept me informed every step of the way and my car was finished relatively quick. Big thanks to Bonifords I know where I’m going for all of my mechanical needs!

resp.text: Thank you!!

text: Incredibly honest. My mother had something wrong with her steering and instead of just charging her to fix it themselves, they told her she could get it fixed for free because it was actually a recall.

resp.text: Thank you!! We’re happy to help!

name: Liz Knight
text: We  have been using Bodiford's exclusively for the past 9+years for all of our automotive needs, from automotive repair, emergency towing assistance, purchase of tires to general maintenance and oil changes on our vehicles.  The office staff is knowledgeable, competent and courteous from initial contact for assistance through completion of the service needed.  The automotive mechanics/technicians/staff are well trained and have provided  excellent service and assistance.  Excellent service  in a timely manner with no runaround as well as reasonable costs go a long way.  Having a trustworthy source for all of our automotive needs gives us great peace of mind.  Thank you for going over and above the norm for your customers.

resp.text: Thank you!

text:

Once it was discovered that repair was more then the value of the car, Bodiford found scrap dealer that would pay the most!

They were so helpful and patient through the process!

name: leb sitham
text:
If I could give them 6 stars, I would but there are only 5.  The personnel in this shop are highly skilled - they fixed all model cars-  friendly, kind and thoughtful.

The belt to our Subaru Outback while traveling on I-10W broke or was torn. We got stranded and had to be towed to Bodiford Automotive by recommendation of AAA.  It so happened that the hotel nearby was sold out and we were traveling home for the Thanksgiving holiday. We spent the night in our car in the parking lot of Bodiford. When the first personnel showed up to open the shop, my husband went to talk to her to notify her of our predicament. My husband came back to the car and told me that she’s making coffee and that we could use the bathroom, and look at the car as soon as the shop opens.

They fixed our car emergency as soon as they opened.  We were backed on the road in two hours. If they were close where we live, Bodiford Automotive  will be our new service advisors.  Thank you very much!

Sure their knowledgable, but they try an rail road you into more than you need. There are plenty of knowledgable mechanics out there that are more honest and lower prices.

name: Paul Mince
text:
Awesome shop and even better people…we were sort of in a bind and Mr. Frank Bodiford personally took care of us.  We were out of state visiting Alabama when the transmission went out on my SUV.  I didn’t know my transmission was bad or about to kick the bucket.  We called around to several nearby shops but no one seemed to have time to take us in.  We were traveling with our three young kids and the situation was getting grim.  We eventually made it around to calling Bodiford’s Automotive Service.  Frank Bodiford attempted to remedy the situation while on the phone. However, all attempts to get out of first/second or go in reverse didn’t work.  I tried putting an additive from AutoZone in the transmission but it was a no go (mind you I am not a car guy).  Mr. Bodiford agreed to look at the vehicle.  It took about 30 minutes to arrive because we could not go over 10-20 mph.  It was late on a Friday and he obviously had other vehicles to repair, which I know now is a testament to his service and crew.  We basically were at his mercy.

Mr. Bodiford immediately took in our vehicle.  His staff ensured we felt like family.  They put on a movie for the kids and made us comfortable as possible.  Although, I was sweating bullets because I figured we were about to get taken advantage of given our urgent situation.  I began searching online for transmission replacement cost, estimated repairs, solenoid issues, etc. and was shell shocked at the prices.  It became apparent we needed transmission work immediately or was not getting very far.  Mr. Bodiford soon emerged and confirmed our fears.  We were weighing our options about how to get back home, getting the vehicle serviced, paying for the diagnostics, paying Frank for the time he took to service the vehicle, etc.  It seemed a bad situation was just getting worse; I was ready to just pay up, get a rental, and be done with the situation.  Mr. Bodiford provided us with all the information needed to help get us situated.  To my surprise they were able to get the vehicle into reverse and the transmission was at least operable.  Apparently, they disengaged the transmission safe mode and used an additive the actually worked.  I stood there with credit card in hand and Mr. Bodiford declined.  He serviced the vehicle as much as he could at the last minute and we were ripe for the taking; however, he wouldn’t take a penny.  I stood there in disbelief and was extremely grateful.  I was thinking about the bad publicity some mechanic shops get and here Mr. Bodiford stood just as concerned, courteous, and empathetic to our situation as if we were his family.  We departed Bodiford's Automotive and traded in the vehicle that evening.  We didn’t want to press our luck with trying to drive home.  Although we took a hit on the trade-in value because of the transmission, we were just elated with Mr. Bodiford and his crew.  Hopefully I do not have any repair needs in the immediate future since I now have a newer vehicle but if so, I am taking it to Mr. Bodiford.  Enough cannot be said when you deal with good people. We sincerely thank them.

resp.text: Wow! Just seeing this great rating and comments. We appreciate your business and kind words.
