name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text: I gave one star because the girl at front is very sweet and there was a helpful guy, but we left car on a Wednesday at 10am. I explained we really needed the car asap because I have cancer and lupus etc and will be hard for me to give people rides to work etc at 5am! They explain there was cars in front of mine (6) Thursday it was to be done...nope! Friday the were sure by then...NO, the mechanic that looked at it had left for the day and weekend. The other mechanics had jobs and they couldn't get to mine...nothing! They need a mechanic for minor jobs like mine (bearings to be replaced) and other mechanics for the bigger jobs...if you got one car and need it done same or next day or actually in three ...don't go here! I feel the mechanic that looked at the car should have just fixed it. Oh they were supposed to have called as well..no such thing happened, the mechanic just didn't want to do the job! I have never taken a car somewhere where they did not have their stuff together like this place! Never even called for a status update or to tell us anything about the car! Taking car to another place who can have work done in one hour!!! The car set there for 3 days!!!!!

name: Carole Juarez
text: Amazing company!!!  We were referred by discount tire. Polite hard-working people. Thank you for putting us back on the road so quickly. Feeling safe Carole

name: Joe Shultz
text:
I went there for a new water pump for a Chevy SUV. A new water pump was installed, but didn't last 100 miles. I returned the vehicle only to have the auto shop refuse to replace the water pump free of charge. I removed the water pump that weekend to find they cross threaded the new water pump and warped the unit. No wonder it did not function properly. After re-tapping a couple of screws and several hours out of my Saturday I replaced the new pump myself. Now I am out the price of another water pump, thanks a lot.

Many people do not know this, but each repair job has an attached amount of time associated with it. So, if an auto center changes your brakes in 30 min but the book says it takes 1.5 hours, then the shop charges you for the extra hour as an extra rake. Now, I do not mind paying the extra as long as the quality matches. This shop may do quick work, but it is not at the quality I am paying for. Poor value given, and they would not make it right either. Basically the repair guy did not remove all the necessary components (like a radiator) to save some time and shoved the water pump in at an angle.

I will never use them again.

name: Heather M
text: Griffin is a lifesaver! My truck blew a spark plug and I had two kids with me along with my husband. We were about 300 miles from home! I thought we were stranded and repair was going to cost a fortune. Griffin used his OWN vehicle to drive 3 exits up to assist us. He was able to get the undamaged spark plug back in and also brought us a brand new coil pack and put it in. He did this repair out of the kindness of his heart and we cannot thank him enough! He was honest from the get go. He could have told us the truck needed a new head or worse and made a ton of money, but he fixed the problem quickly and didn't charge us a fractuon of what he could have! Thank you Griffin, you were our Angel! His shop may be behind sometimes, but he is worth the wait if you want an honest mechanic!

name: Sheree Lewis
text: New owner, great guy great work! I recommend this place for all your auto work .

name: Travis Gibbs
text:
I brought my car and truck to them when they first opened. They fixed both and stuck to fair estimate.

I wouldn't do business with them now after my last experience.

Month 1 & 2
Our car needed a new engine. The shop owner wanted to get an engine from his supplying junkyard. He missed one that became available. This process took about 2 weeks before we decided to find an engine ourselves which he was not happy with but agreed to. He said they could have it put in within a 3 day period. The engine company we bought from needed it done in 10 days for warranty purposes. Griffith used all of the 10 days to because other cars came in front of me while we had to wait on engine. They finally got it in and started but had to send to dealership because the car went into anti-theft mode and wouldn't start. We had to actually arrange the drop off to the dealership ourselves. I feel like we were running his business for him because he was almost never there. The employees even mentioned that problem in passing.

Month 3
We become worried after not hearing anything from dealership or Griffin for about 2.5ish weeks. I had to contact dealership for them to tell me that they told Griffin that the car needed a major fuse panel that could be $1200+. I called Griffin to tell him I approved the install because we really needed the car. It's month 3 folks!

Is it Month 4? Getting close anyway.
We had to go ourselves to the dealership to confront them about not getting to our car. This should be Griffin's job. The dealership says that the part didn't fix the problem. Car still doesn't work. We decide to give up because the car needed another part for $2400 to "maybe" fix. We decide to just give up. Dealership is trying to get more money from us even though they didn't fix the problem. Griffin is trying to put that on us. We said we would pay for his time, but does this seem fair? Griffin himself might be a knowledgable mechanic, but he is a rookie business owner with no organization or management skills of his people.  He wasted a huge amount of our time (3+months), money ($6000+) and stressed my wife and I to no end. We are going to have to scrap our car with a new engine that doesn't run.

They do good oil changes and put a muffler on another car we brought, but he also made me pay for the part up front which shows bad business to me as well.

* FINAL RESULT
paid griffin $1400 because the car ended up not working out. He said he made no money and it would have been $2000 if it had worked + whatever it would be to charge AC. When we walked in to pay he didn't even recognize us. My wife and I talked to this guy several times in person and on phone. The waiting area had mice running around too FYI if you are scared of them. After that we went to the dealer shop that had our car and basically gave it to the tech working on it. he paid for the dealer work and gave us a little cash. When we went to clean the car out I noticed that the driver seat leather looked very dirty and worn. Griffin said he was sorry.

name: Kristina Garrison
text: I am honestly disappointed, this shop has Amazing POTENTIAL. However, I don't feel it is being ran efficiently. I have called with no answer, mupltiple occasions. I also have the concern of the child/childern that are running through shop all day, most days. I have also had to keep from hitting many toys, many times. I believe the shop is in an amazing location, and again has all potential in the wprld. Unfourtnally, right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Chris Ruffin
text:
I moved to McCalla in March of 2015. I was looking for a dependable repair shop that did quality work and that I could become a repeat customer with. I chose Griffin Automotive because they are ASE certified and after using them with 3 vehicles (06 Nissan Altima, 05 Chevy Silverado, & 2015 Nissan Altima) I have had no complaints with them.

They do great work, and are realistic with their estimates. If you are looking for a repair shop with a quick turnaround (meaning hours instead of days) then this may not be the shop for you, but I have a spare vehicle and can leave the vehicle for repairs.  They typically tell me that they have other vehicles in front of mine, but will look at it as soon as they get a free moment. I have sent my cars or truck to them at least 9 times (using both the overnight drop box and just bringing it in) and have only waited longer than a day once (and that was because the part got their late in the evening and I picked it up after work the next day)

I have had multiple types of jobs: brakes pads for Altima and Silverado, rotors for Altima and Silverado,, brake drums for Silverado, oil change for Altima and Silverado, window regulator replacement on Silverado, oil leak repair on Altima, engine mounts on Altima, transfer case replacement Silverado 4x4, along with other normal maintenance type items

name: Shane P
text: Great family-run business. Honest work, fair prices, and quick turnaround. The Howard family are great people, and I would trust them with any vehicle repairs and tire work. Their tow service is also fast and dependable when needed.

resp.text: Hi Shane P, Thank you for taking the time to leave us such a beautiful review. Most people don't bother to leave reviews about positive experiences non incentivized, and that's what makes this so special! It's only when we receive such positive feedback, do we rest knowing that we have done our jobs well. Thank you for giving us this proverbial pat on the back, you made our day! We will strive to deliver great experiences consistently, please do visit us again.

text:
On Nov. 7, 2018 I went in to get an oil change. Told me it might be awhile, that was ok with me, had to shop anyways.
About an hour later the called me, as I was driving away I noticed they had not reset my oil life gauge..I turned around went back and they acted like it wasnt a big deal. But, they reset it.
On the 17th of Nov a team of of us went to Kinard Fl to give a Thanksgiving dinner to that community. On the highway, the plate under the car that protects the engine fell on the road, the noise made me pull to side of road. Luckily, there was a mechanic with us, who got under the car and took it off..
It was put back on with a plastic screw and a zip tie From getting my oil changed!
Needless to say, walmart TLC will never see me again...or about 25+ people in this area who were either with me or have heard this story..We are still telling it btw.

text: Not usually one to leave a review especially a bad one, but in this case I have to. I took my car in ti have a radiator replaced, once there i was told a day later that the thermostat should be replaced. Bought a new thermostat and the next day i was told that the housing for the thermostat needs to be replaced. I take that and they said they couldnt put the part matched thermostat on my car then couldnt put the old one back on. After coming up pn a Saturday and sitting in the dollar general accross the street i saw people sitting and eating chips hanging out(maybe they were on break idk) once they saw me in the other parkinglot they moved my car behind the shop(adter walking around it constantly) i wqs told vy the older gentleman that he would go to fix it himself and he wanted to let the sealant cure for a day. I called agead and they said it was done so I picked it up Monday qfter it being there for a week and didnt make it to lily flag dr before it ran hot again. So i have to take it to another shop and they also didnt put the bolts back on my engine cover. I was told to bring the car back because they dont know the size of the bolts.

name: Melia F.
text: I have been to this location 6 times and I will continue to come back! My mom just left this location about 20 minutes ago after my recommendation to her and she called me to tell me how impressed she was with the employees and their willingness to go out of their way, specifically Conlee this morning. I used to be one of those people who ONLY got serviced at the dealership but this Express is so impressive. The employees are mainly younger guys but they are all polite, patient, and personable! The managers, Tim specifically, are also patient, and helpful both on the phone and in store and truly take time out of their day to talk to you about servicing, previous records, dates of service, and HONEST recommendations. You will NOT wait in line here like you will at the dealership, the longest time I've waited for the entire oil change to be done is 15 minutes here, and that included the "wait" to begin. Everyone here has a great attitude and a willingness to help! I cannot say enough positive things about this Express location, you will always be treated like a human and not just the next car in line.

text: Unprofessional and shady.  They wanted me to pay them $2300.00 for repairs and when I picked the car up to get another opinion they acted like the biggest jerks. I recommend steering clear of the Homewood location, the location on West Valley is much better.

name: Holly Carr
text: Went to this location for an oil change, but my tire pressure light was on so I got them to check on this too.  One of my tires was entirely too low (pressure at 15 when should be at 35, all other tires were only at 30).  Any knowledgeable technician would have removed my tire to check for a leak, but he insisted the tire was fine.  After filling the tires & resetting, the tire pressure light was still on.  He told me not to worry and to "be careful" with that tire--incredibly vague.  Turns out there was a leak, which left me with a flat tire & stranded in Atlanta the next day.  It's clear that the technicians I dealt with had a blatant disregard for my safety and the safety of my vehicle.  I will never return to another Express Oil Change, nor recommend this location to anyone I know.

text: Quick service, friendly technicians, easy to understand options! Adam was very helpful with understanding what we needed and how long it would take/how much it would cost! I will be returning!

name: Matthew Tucker
text:
I noticed gas dripping near my fuel filter.  I didn't know for sure exactly where or what was causing it, didn't want to spend my only free evening of the week with my wife and kid trying to figure it out, but also didn't want to leave a leak overnight so I took off work early to go get it fixed.  My vehicle needed an oil change as well anyway so I took it in and explained it was likely the filter or one of the lines that needed replaced.

Sure they changed my oil no problem, but the guy came around and said he wouldn't fix the leak, that it was a "missing o-ring that they didn't carry in stock" and I'd need to take it back to whoever put the existing filter on and have them do the repair.  Now, I replace my filters every 40,000 miles or so and I've moved a couple of times since then.  I have no idea where I was exactly when I replaced my filter last, because it's a small fix.  I got there at 4:30 pm, close of business at 6, so it wasn't like I pulled up at quitting time.  I had to take more time off work the next morning to disconnect everything myself and find it was simply a hairline crack in the filter.  The mechanic that I talked to didn't even verify anything, except what I already knew that yep there's a fuel leak there.  He just spewed some bs that he thought sounded good because he didn't feel like doing his job... REPLACING A DAMAGED FUEL FILTER SO I'M NOT DRIPPING GASOLINE EVERYWHERE I GO.

I'll find somewhere else for auto service, and I'd recommend you do the same if it's anything other than an oil change.

resp.text: Hi Matthew. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

text: Its amazing how God leads you in the right direction! My wife and I were 450 miles away from home and was having tire problems. The staff was amazing and a great group of people! The met me in the parking lot, got me in and pretty much just took over. Such a relief to find a place like this that knew what they were doing and to be treated the way we were! I will find out what the gentleman's name was and post it again, just because he was that kind of man! After all that! They would not let me pay them! And I tried! My wife was in tears (of relief and joy) because of him! I rated them 5 stars only because there isn't a sixth! That you guys and God bless them! We're finally home safe in NC only because of them! name: Shane McCart
text: Had oil changed by Express and afterafter I noticed my car leaking oil. I took it back to Express and the guy said it was leaking from the drain plug and for me to go purchase one and bring it back and he would replace it. I take it back the next day and still leaking after replacing it and so the guy proceeds to say I need a new oil pan and they would email me the price for oil pan and installation. A week went by and I never received the email nor a phone call. I took my car to the dealer and and they replaced my oil pan. They said it was stripped and they (Express) had try to repair it with a repair kit but obviously didn't work. My car was not leaking oil before I took it to Express but was after they changed my oil and so they costed me $560+. I will not be going back to Express for anything.

resp.text: Mr. McCart, I am sorry to hear about the issue you had with your vehicle. Please allow me to see if I can help in this matter. name: phil lindley
text: I used to only drive big name brand tires$$$, which were usually put on at Sam's or Costo. After an issue with one of the $$$ tires purchased, I found out they are not a typical stock item and I'd have to wait for several days. Since I needed it repaired immediately, I drove directly to Pete Shirley and told them to get close on the orginal tires ratings (speed/trac/hardness) with something they normally stock and replace all 4. Not only did they drive the same,  they were significantly cheaper than the big name brands. The biggest plus, I was back on the road in about an hour. I've waited over 4hours at some places in the past. Since, I've replaced tires on my other 4 vehicles using Pete Shirley. Asked them to put on something they normally stocked on these 4 vehicles, and all road out great, and in and out of the store in a timely manner. They also don't sell the gimmicky road side warranty. But I'd bet they'd do all they could to help you out if something happens outside of the tires warranty.

resp.text: Hello. Thank you for your great review. It was our pleasure to serve you as a customer. We appreciate you taking the time to leave this positive review about your experience. We are always happy to hear good things from our customers. If at anytime you find yourself in need of our services, do not hesitate to reach out to us at socialcare@bfrc.com and we would be more than happy to assist you in scheduling an appointment. Thank you for contacting Firestone. We look forward to working with you in the future. ^Morgan

name: e douglas pratt
text:
Friday January 17 and Saturday the 18th, 2020, Michael and Jonathan at the Oxford, Alabama Firestone store exceeded my expectations . I was traveling from Atlanta to Birmingham when my tire light went on. I made it on my run-flat to their store. They showed me the irreparable damage and found a tire in Birmingham. It would be delivered Saturday; but the Saturday delivery failed to bring that tire. Instead of waiting til Monday, Michael and Jon immediately offered to get the tire from Birmingham themselves. Jonathan made the trip and I was driving safely away later Saturday afternoon. Michael, Jonathan, and their Oxford, Alabama team make Firestone look very good. Please give them a substantial raise. If that's not immediately forthcoming, please embarrass them with lavish praise at your next regional meeting.

Dr. E. Douglas Pratt
Atlanta, Georgia

resp.text: Hi, E Douglas. Wow! We are so thrilled to hear that your recent visit was superior to satisfactory. Vehicles are our passion, but you really are our priority. We appreciate you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We look forward to working with you again, and thank you for choosing Firestone! ^Mariah

name: Deborah Waddell
text:
While the price for my tires and oil change were less than quoted, I do have some complaints: the employee did NOT do requested alignment
he tried talking me into "Fuel System Cleaning" & Renu Fuel System
Cleaner" ($89.99 & $9.99) which I just had done 2 wks prior at my
dealer)
DID NOT cold pressure balance my tires (from the photo of my dash PSI
info: LF 39 RF 39; LR 38 RR 43--what the heck??); on 2009 Chev HHR LS recommended PSI is 30-32 for 15s, 16s respectively. While it won't necessarily affect mileage that much for minor variations, it will affect the wear and tear.
It makes me mad when MEN in the automotive industry think they can pull things over on women. LADIES BE AWARE.
It pays to be an informed consumer and to listen, and if they are slick salesmen like the one serving me, listen twice as hard because he made me think that the alignment check was the alignment being done. Shame shame shame.

** This happened at the Oxford Quintard Mall location but it won't let me put my review on their page.

text: Almost 400 dollars for 4 new tires and the next morning one is completely flat and one is half way. text: I just went to Walmart (9:40 am) to get 4 tires mounted on my trailer. It was NO cars in the bay at all. I was one car in front of me that was getting one wiper replaced. I called them and they pulled me right in. The tires came off in less than two minutes after I parked and installed in less than 30 minutes! The service is great and quick 5 stars!!!

name: e o
text:
This team did a fantastic job with how busy and short staffed they were. We travelled in from out of state and wanted to make sure our tires were good enough for the drive home. We had to purchase two new tires. They gave me the best price for the tires they had in stock. Mostly I’d like to commend Chico the tire tech. He came into store to speak with me to ensure we placed the correct tires in the correct positions. It really shows he cares about the safety of the customers and is passionate about what he does. Very thorough!

Thank you for helping my family get home safely.

name: Jason Kirkland
text:
The gentleman who writes up the ticket is one of the most unprofessional people I have came across. Rude and threw down his hand held and told another employee to handle. It all stem from me and him talking about oil and I followed him to check and see what oil
He had. I cross into shop and he went crazy. The two gentlemen he passed me off to was wonderful. This happen at 815am on 2-4-20.

name: Cora Marsh
text: I was pleasantly impressed with the service I received at Walmart on the Southern Blvd a couple of weeks ago. The young lady was very good she got  my info as to what I  wanted and answered my questions which she could answer for  me and verified 1st that the tires I wanted was there and referred me to the Mechanic and he was very helpful and I was in and out and got groceries paid for and walked to the Service Dept with my groceries in the  buggy and paid my bill and rolled out to my car loaded my groceries in the car and  another young lady said she wld return my buggy to the store so I was very happy and excited to get my new tires and groceries and they put 2 of my tires in my trunk as I requested since they still had more rubber than the 2 front tires and they may come in handy one day!BLESSINGS to the WALMART FAMILY!👍🏼👍🏼😇

name: Gil W
text: I’m 60 yrs old; and have never enjoyed an oil change until today. I pulled up to the obviously vacant area. Guy came out immediately and asked about my needs. (All employees distancing or masked). Another directed me over the pit. One of 3 Kevins came to my truck window and managed my request. (I got Short Kevin; they have also have a tall Kevin and an ugly Kevin) They were very professional! It was like watching a perfectly choreographed dance. I never exited my vehicle; and observed the same superlative service being given to customers to my left and right. Short Kevin, AJ  and Clayton were very professional and consulted me at every milestone of their service (which I was watching!). They were also genuinely friendly!!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive words, Gil! When our customers are happy, we’re happy. We look forward to doing business with you again in the future!

name: Heath King
text: The guys over at Express Oil in Muscle Shoals are unbelievable.  Lots of drive up oil change places have a faded old sign hanging up that lists their free 200 point inspection, but you end up leaving with no low fluid levels, a stripped oil plug, and nothing more said about the condition of your vehicle than "it's full of oil." Not these guys, they are in a league by themselves. They do great work, they are knowledgeable,  friendly, reliable and most important, Honest! Best of all they have another shop on site with techs that can do a wide range of repairs and diagnostics. Plainly put, you can rest assured that you, your wife, your teenager, etc will drive off with a well-serviced vehicle, Every Time!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Heath! We’re glad you’re satisfied with the support you received from our team and hope to do business with you again in the future!

text: While working out of town company truck broke down due to a fuel filter. Truck died pulling in parking lot. Shot starter fluid to get fired back up and was told they could not change filter unless a full diagnosis was run on truck. I asked if we could buy a fuel filter for truck and was told no. Asked where closest part store was, I was told and I quote "we have several around". Very disappointed in customer service. Will not be back to this place

Please visit us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and leave your contact information, as well as the details of your experience, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Mary Hall
text: I usually use a different service, but they were very backed up so I drove down the road just to have my tires checked because my TP light came on. The gentleman looked at my low tire for about 30 seconds and told me there was a nail and because of where it was on the tire they wouldn’t be able to patch it and I needed a whole new tire. Also that the tread on all my tires was getting low so I needed a whole new set. The set he tried to sell me was almost $1,000. Luckily I had my dog in the back seat, so I had a good excuse to get out of there and tell them I’d come back later. I don’t know a whole lot about cars, but I know when my tire tread looks low and I’ve got at least until the end of this year or the beginning of next before I’ll need new tires. And as for the one with the nail, my cousin patched it and I’ve driven to Birmingham and back on it with no problem at all. Seems like to me they saw a single woman and assumed I wouldn’t have any sort of knowledge and tried to take advantage.

resp.text: Hi Mary. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Blue Octopus
text: I've been going to Express Oil Change for about 2 years to get my oil changed. Recently, my car decided to break down pretty close to these guys. I got it to the place and they had to order a few new parts for my clutch. The job took twice as long as expected. Unless they were trying to add more stuff to my bill, I was not updated about the status of my car unless I called or randomly showed up. I was severely over charged. When I picked up my car, all my saved radio buttons had been changed to different stations. Coffee, a notebook and some small car part (not even sure what it was) were left in my car, none of which were mine, all of which I threw away. I'm glad I had nothing valuable in my car if their workers are this unprofessional. I WILL NOT be going back. Go somewhere else. This place is not worth your time or anyone else's.

resp.text: Blue Octopus - Thank you for your feedback. We would appreciate the opportunity to restore your confidence in our company by addressing your concerns and preventing it from happening again. Please visit https://www.expressoil.com/contact/?google to provide your contact information as well as the details you provided here, and we will get in touch with you shortly.

name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

name: Richard Bruce
text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. Your concerns are very important to us, and we're saddened to know this experience has jeopardized your future loyalty. Please allow us to allay your concerns by contacting our Customer Service team at 800-447-3070. Thank you.

name: Monicka Lemon
text: This is the first time that I came to this particular location. Over the phone we talked about a full synthetic oil change but when I went to pay, they just did a basic oil change and didn't put the next service sticker on the windshield. I probably won't go back to this location.

resp.text: Thank you very much for the high recommendation, David! Our team appreciates your support and positive feedback, and we look forward to future opportunities to be of assistance.

Never again.

Almost 2 hours for an oil change when you are the only the only customer there.

I’ll give them credit for comping the service for me, but didn’t appreciate them saying it was because the wrong part was delivered, when I heard them order the filter for the wrong model vehicle and also never communicating that there would be a delay because they didn’t have the correct filter in stock.

Also, so much drama.

resp.text: It's disheartening to know that your visit did not exceed your expectations as we would have intended, Renae, as we would never want anything to deter you from returning for future services. We do not take your comments lightly, so we ask that you call our Customer Service at 800-447-3070 to allow us a chance to fully address your concerns. Thank you.

Even with paying $12 for the installation, we saved money by getting our battery at this location. The best part, however, was not the money we saved it was the customer service. Sterling is awesome and Walmart should pay him to teach a class on customer service to other locations. He is an excellent communicator and even assisted with the battery installation. We will be back.

text: If I could give 0 stars I would. Worst experience EVER. They have had my car for over a week doing recall work to it. They have no concept of time. This is NOT my first bad experience with them, but I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and give them another try. MY MISTAKE. They should not even be in the customer service business. Lack of communication between the workers is ridiculous. My car could be on fire and I would NEVER bring it here again.

name: renea waller
text: I took my Ford Explorer in for service today scheduled appointment might I add for a oil change and for them to check my back up camera and to please call me before he did anything to the camera and let me know how much it would cost me. I expressed this 3 times to him and he said no problem. Got a call from him and he informed me that the had filed a claim with my insurance and that it was going to cost me 400.00 plus the oil change, I told him NO! I just wanted to get a estimate and that I was not going to pay for the camera being fix right now, he was not happy and said he would get my car ready and I could come pick it up. I then ask did they even change my oil and he said,"oh not yet". They had my car from 7:00 A.M. scheduled appointment until 6:36 P.M. needless to say I had to call to see if it was even ready yet. He said," yes", and I ask for a total of my bill he states he needed to do another ticket but it would be around 150, no more. I get there and they have charged me 175.26 (WOW)! for a oil change and to look at my camera to tell me it needed to be replaced. Then I also noticed they decided to donate 2.00 of that to drive pink. I called to complain but of course it didn't matter, was told they did want to lose my business well guess what you have. It's a shame as a woman you can't go by yourself to get your car taken care of without men taking advantage of you. Well you might want to think twice before going there. My advice to you is to it to ask for Brandon, because when I called back to complain he was very helpful. And thanks for my courtesy vacuum and wash that I did not receive but was told ALL OUR CUSTOMERS RECEIVE THAT!!!!

name: Raj kumar
text: I've never had such a Bad experience from car service center , I was called for air bag recall , when I brought it in they made me feel like they are doing me a favour ,they changed my delivery time four times I had to take two days off work , they ignore you at the front desk and are very rude over the phone.They  asked my friend Who accompanied me to the service center to leave while she was waiting in the lobby cause it was a cold evening, finially when I got my car ,I asked for the paper work for which they were reluctant to give and then when  I go see my car it had food leftovers  and bottle caps in the front seat  it looked like someone ate in there ,the back seat had come off which didn't  any sense when it was a air bag recall , this is the  worst place to get your car serviced they don't care about coustomer's safety forget satisfaction. Wish I could give zero stars.

name: Cameron Hunt
text: Ive never had a bad experience with this service department. The service advisors and techs are always professional

name: Alycia E
text: Don't waste your time like I did. Instead just make the trip over to Honda in Columbus. The service will be top-notch. I travel constantly and have owned Honda's for 25 years. I have been to dealerships everywhere. I had a minor issue that could have been fixed quickly. Upon arriving at the run down shop the workers did everything they could to avoid acknowledging me. Wish I could have got his name specifically in the parts dept. He literally jumped on his cell phone when he saw me walk up. He didn't have a name tag on. Then I went into the service dept door and the man behind the counter has the audacity to tell me we MIGHT get you some time this afternoon. Mind you I'm traveling through which I mentioned, and I'm a single female. The issue literally just required a look at and some advice. Being in the medical field I understand being busy better then anyone. BUT there is never an excuse for being rude, and dismissive in business. I literally drive 45 mins to another dealership because you guys were so rude!

name: Jackenstein
text:
If you’re not sure, DO NOT come here!
Last week I stopped in the service department to ask if they would be able to fix my car’s broken sunroof seal. It is torn, off of its track, dry-rotted and very obviously needs replacing. The man at the front desk walks out with me to my car to see the problem and sees it as clearly as I could. We went back into the shop to set up an appointment that ended up being for a whole week later which was excessively long for the possibility of my car getting flooded if it rained. Today after the week had gone by, I took my car in told them my name and that I had an appointment, which they seemed not to even have on their books of me scheduling, asked for my address, phone number, and for the keys. Nearly 2 hours later I finally get a call back from them saying they didn’t have the part in stock, that they hadn’t done any kind of research on what my options were before my appointment (which we agreed they would do), told me they couldn’t get the seal as an individual part but would have to replace the whole sunroof instead, and that if I wanted that done it would be over $700 for it or if not that they would only charge $110 for running their “diagnostics”. A fee for “Diagnostics” to look at my car for no more than a minute to tell my seal had dry-rotted and needed replacing, really? It ended up being $117.70 after an additional charge of “supplies and/or hazardous waste removal” for a single floor mat, some identifying tags for my car and keys and some receipts. Not to mention there wasn’t a seat cover used despite their own disclosure sign saying they would be using them to slow the spread of coronavirus. I do not feel as though this charge was necessary and very much should have been avoided if they would done the work that was expected of them ahead of time. They will not be receiving any more of my business nor should they receive yours if your issue isn’t urgent or too difficult to do yourself.

name: Jennifer Keller
text:
I took my car to be serviced for three warning lights that repeatedly came on intermittently  (VSA, Power Steering and Emission). They stated it would cost $120 to diagnose the problem. Four hours later they called to tell me they found two pistons misfiring but it would cost another $120 to go any further to determine what was causing it.

I would give a negative number if possible. This service department is BY FAR the most dishonest service department with whom I have ever dealt in the past 34 years that I have been driving. I wouldn’t take my bicycle to them for repairs!!

name: Kati's World
text:
Back in February I brought my car in for just an oil change, but it ended up costing me over 400 dollars. However, I was willing to pay for it since I live over an hour and a half away, and it is a big deal for my car to be safe. Immediately after I left I noticed that wind was whistling through one of my doors and my brakes were squeaking. Then my radio completely stops working, and I decided to give this place another chance. We then brought my car in to get diagnosed, and were not made aware that they did not have a shuttle or anyway for us to leave the property besides uber.  After the diagnoses we got told by the service lady, to bring our car back in two days on Wednesday and that our rental would be free for two days, and that warranty would be covering the costs. Later that day we get a call from this same lady and in this call she tells us that my car would cost us at least 1800 dollars to get fixed, and that we had to pay for the rental car that we were driving. They also said that the pipe that needed to be fixed was bent in on purpose, and that we had done it (keep in mind that the only people who drive this car are two females who know nothing about cars). We were livid. They put the car back together and we got a second opinion, and turns out what they stated is wrong isn't.

The sales lady also reprimended a child for something she knew nothing about. I would give this place zero stars if I had the option. Overall, this is the worst experience I have ever had with a car place!

name: Joy Johnson
text: Feel like I got a good deal. Photo is of a different lot. But King got my business on this same model. Saved $875 off LaGrange Honda.

name: Justin Smith
text: Thank you Rodney for making the buying experience smooth and simple! I had a professional, businesslike experience and made a deal for my new Honda. The model I wanted wasn't available on the lot, so they picked it up and drove it in from Huntsville, keeping me informed every step of the way. Call Rodney at King Honda when you are in the market for your next vehicle.

text: Nice people, but it kinda feels like a used car dealership externally. It’s any to miss on the road. Just not as nice as the local Nissan or Toyota dealership

Communication has been lacking when they said they would call me back they never would and has happened every day since then. Experience has made me feel like they’re trying to screw me over and rip me off

text: Amazing customer service — thanks Ricky! Had a great experience when I brought my car in very last minute. They were able to figure out what was wrong and fix it pretty quickly. Overall a great place.

name: kelly brown
text: Jay Manning made the process very smooth from the beginning. Very professional, polite and was able to help me find my perfect car within minutes. I will be recommending King Honda to my family and friends.

name: evelyn hodges
text: Really appreciate Stacey W for getting my part secured in a hurry on a saturday! Very dependable!

name: Maggie McCoy
text: I've been going here for a number of years for service on my Honda. I don't have anything but good things to say about them! I've always had a great experience and they really value loyal customers. They've kept my car running in perfect condition and never made me feel like they were upselling anything or treating me like a woman who doesn't know anything (a rare quality in my experience with car service shops!). They always take time to explain to me what was done and why they did it. They clearly indicate the wear on each of the car components so that I have a record and can anticipate service that I might need in the future. I went to another Honda location once and they said I needed new brakes. They didn't give me any other reason than the service guy's opinion. I took my car to King Honda and told them that the other place had said I needed new brakes at my next visit. King Honda measured the wear and said it wasn't necessary based on the wear. I was very impressed by the fact that they went by the numbers rather than taking the chance to sell me some brakes that I didn't really need quite yet. Even after I moved away from Auburn, I still come back to get my car serviced here. Thanks to everyone there for keeping me a happy customer!

text: Horrible service.

text: Great service on my car and friendly employee s

text: Very unprofessional, kept my car 4 days past when they said it could be completed, changed my ignition switch/cylinder and broke my windshield switch and after said that there was no proof that they did it. I would not recommend this place to anybody save your time and money and get professional work and service from a better dealership.

text: You can't go wrong. These kind people aren't sales people. They are your friend for the day when you make a purchase. Reid is the man to see. He put my 17 year old in a low mileage dependable car. Danielle got the payments just right for me. I loved the experience so much... I'm going back to get a brand new civic. Thank you so much King!!

Staff is very friendly and I wasn't pressured to have other work done than what I brought my Honda in for. Fast and friendly service, overall our experience was very good.

Without any obligation on my part, he let me take more than one car home with me overnight for my husband to check-out. In short, he is willing to work with people to find the right car at the right price.

text: Service department is amazing here and sales was very helpful and not pushy! These guys took the burden of a bad local shop and did the best they could for me. I cannot emphasize how important it is to take your vehicle to a reputable place like this before taking it to a specialized place for repair. Save yourself the headache and use these guys, they know what they are doing and are very helpful!

text: Candy was awesome again! We have purchased 2 cars from her 😊

name: King Honda
text: The worst dealership ever.  Bought a brand new, touring model Accord from them, and they can't keep my name or service records straight.  Service department does not want to help you with issues and is rude.   Waiting room is dirty, and staff from upstairs are running back and forth gossiping and being dramatic with each other. They will never have another sale from me.  If I could rate them less than one star, I would.

name: Amber Carroll
text: I bought my car last week from there. It was an amazing experience. Apply online and Candy Maynard is the online financing specialist. I truly recommend her she bent over backwards for me and I had never met her. When I got approved and I was told over the phone the amazing deal I got and when I got there it was all true. I truly LOVE this dealer and will be back.

name: Katherine Haas
text: As someone who dreads going to auto repair shops, I am happy to say that my experience at King Honda Auburn-Opelika was completely easy and stress-free. The staff was very nice and helpful, and I did not feel that I was being taken advantage of like I have at other auto shops. Great service!

name: Barış Köprülüoğlu
text:
Dealerships=Stealerships. King Honda is a good example of this fact.
My battery cable got corroded. I got my car towed to King Honda. It took them 4 days(!) to figure out the problem and they said the cable should be replaced which costs $260. I said no and got my car towed to Auburn Starters and Generators. They cleaned up the cable for $10 in 15 minutes and the car worked just fine. Honda didn’t even bother cleaning up the cable (which is something very easy for them to do) and charged me $60 diagnostic fee. STAY AWAY from King Honda! They will try to steal your money from the very first moment you walk into the service.

name: T Moraes
text: I came here to get my car serviced. They completed the service faster than anticipated and the staff were knowledgeable and friendly. They provided great customer service and they were very accommodating.

name: Amanda Moncus
text: I was seeking a used Honda Fit. Purchased a BRAND new 2016 Honda Fit for an EXCELLENT price!!! SPECIAL Thanks to RICKY WAVER/MARK SCHNEIDER/JEFF STEWART, MIKE SILVER, and all the Great staff here at King Honda for the WONDERFUL and PLEASANT experience!!! I am VERY Appreciative of them for helping me get a New Honda Fit! EXTREMELY SATISFIED‼️
